title: Angel One Support Knowledge Base
description: Comprehensive FAQ collection from Angel One support pages

faqs.question: Why is my trading balance not updated even after adding funds successfully?
faqs.answer:
If your trading balance is not updated after a successful fund addition, it could be due to the following reasons:

• High Volume of Requests: When there is a high volume of fund addition requests, it might take some time to update your balance. Please wait for 15 minutes.

• Bank Account Issues: Ensure you add funds from the bank account registered with Angel One, and the account should be in your name. If funds are added from an unregistered bank account, the amount might get deducted but will be credited back in 3-4 working days.

faqs.question: Why am I unable to add funds to my Angel One account?
faqs.answer:
You might be unable to add funds to your Angel One account due to the following reasons:

• Unregistered Bank Account: You might be trying to add funds from a bank account not registered with your Angel One account.

• Incorrect UPI ID: The UPI ID used for fund addition might not be mapped to the bank account registered with Angel One.

Ensure you add funds from your bank account registered with Angel One.

faqs.question: Why am I unable to add funds using UPI?
faqs.answer:
You might be unable to add funds via UPI due to the following reasons:

• Bank Account Mismatch: The bank account linked with Angel One is different from the one selected in the UPI app.

• Unregistered UPI ID: Your UPI ID is mapped to a bank account that is not registered with Angel One.

• Timeout: Your UPI request on the app was not accepted within 10 minutes.

• Transfer Limit Exceeded: Your UPI transfer limit set by your bank is exhausted.

• Daily Limit Reached: Your daily UPI transaction limit is reached across all UPI apps.

• Insufficient Balance: You may have an insufficient balance in your bank account.

• Network Issues: Network failure at the bank’s/provider’s system.

• Incorrect UPI ID: Your UPI ID (VPA) entered is incorrect.

• Wrong UPI PIN: You have entered the wrong UPI PIN.

• Incorrect Method: You are transferring funds to Angel One’s UPI ID directly instead of using the ‘Add Funds’ option on the Angel One app/platform.

Ensure you follow the correct procedure and check the above points to resolve the issue.

faqs.question: Why am I unable to add funds using net banking?
faqs.answer:
You might be unable to add funds via net banking due to the following reasons:

• Unregistered Bank Account: You are making payments from a bank account that is not registered with Angel One.

• Mismatched Bank Details: You have added different bank account details on the ‘Add Funds’ page and net banking page.

• Incorrect Credentials: You have entered incorrect credentials on the bank’s net banking page.

• Insufficient Balance: You have insufficient balance in your bank account to make the transaction.

• Transaction Limits: Your bank has placed limits on your transaction amount or the number of transactions.

• Network Failure: There may be a network failure at the bank’s or provider’s system.

Ensure you check these points and follow the correct procedure to add funds via net banking.

faqs.question: What are the different options available to add funds to my Angel One account?
faqs.answer:
You can add funds using any of the following options.

• Add funds using payment apps such as PhonePe, Google Pay, etc.

• Add funds using UPI ID.

• Add funds using net banking.

Please make sure to add funds from your bank account registered with Angel One in all the above options.

faqs.question: Can I add funds from any bank account to my Angel One account?
faqs.answer: No, you can add funds only from your bank account registered with Angel One. This is in accordance with SEBI guidelines. You cannot add funds from a bank account that belongs to your spouse, friend, or anyone else.

faqs.question: How to add funds to my Angel One account?
faqs.answer:
You can add funds online to your Angel One account by following these steps:

• Tap on Account at the bottom of your screen.

• Click on Add Funds.

• Enter the amount and choose the mode of transfer (Google Pay, PhonePe, other UPI methods, or Net banking).

• Follow the subsequent steps to authorize your transaction, and the funds will be added to your account.

Click here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/trading-account/add-funds-the-digital-way) for more details on adding funds.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to add funds via bank account registered with Angel One?
faqs.answer: Yes, as per regulatory guidelines and compliance norms, it is mandatory to transfer funds through the bank accounts registered with Angel One.

faqs.question: Why is my amount debited from bank but not added to my trading balance?
faqs.answer:
If the amount is debited from the bank but not added to your Angel One balance, it could be due to the following reasons:

• Unregistered Bank Account: You might have tried to add funds from an unregistered bank account. The debited amount will be credited back to your bank in 3-4 working days.

• Technical Glitch: There could be a technical glitch at your bank’s end. The debited amount will be refunded in 3-4 working days.

faqs.question: Can I use debit/credit card to add funds to my Angel One account?
faqs.answer: You cannot add funds to your Angel One account using your debit or credit card. As per the regulatory guidelines, your transactions should be from a verified bank account. Also, the usage of credit cards is not allowed in the stock markets.

faqs.question: Is there a limit on the amount of funds that I can add to my Angel One account?
faqs.answer:
• The limit for fund addition via UPI is 1 lakh per day.

• For net banking, the limit will be applicable as per the bank account.

faqs.question: Why were my funds withdrawn and credited to my bank account even though I didn’t place a request?
faqs.answer:
There are two reasons why this could happen.

• Quarterly Settlement: As per the SEBI guidelines, all stockbrokers are required to transfer the funds lying in the client account back to their bank at least once every quarter. The funds will be transferred back to the primary bank account mapped to your Angel One account.

• Fund Settlement Frequency: Your fund settlement frequency might be set to daily settlement. You can edit it by visiting Account → Profile → Fund Settlement Frequency in our mobile app.

faqs.question: What is quarterly settlement of funds or SEBI payout?
faqs.answer: The quarterly settlement of funds is a SEBI requirement for all stockbrokers to settle client funds lying in trading accounts at least once every quarter. The funds are transferred back to the primary bank account mapped to your Angel One account.

faqs.question: When will I get money in my bank account after placing a fund withdrawal request?
faqs.answer:
We process your fund withdrawal request as per the below timeline:

Days
Payout Request Time 
Funds Credited By (approx)

Monday to Friday
12:00 am – 07:00 am
11:30 am, Same Day

07:00 am – 05:30 pm
11:30 pm, Same Day

05:30 pm – 12:00 am 
11:30 am, Next Working Day

Saturday, Sunday
Anytime
11:30 am, Next Working Day

Trading/Settlement Holiday
Anytime
11:30 am, Next Working Day

To learn more about the fund withdrawal cycle, click here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/intraday-trading/funds-payout-explained).

faqs.question: When can I withdraw funds after selling my shares?
faqs.answer:
You can withdraw money from your sell transaction on T+1 day, except for Saturday, Sunday, and Trading/Settlement holidays.

For example, if you sold your shares on 14th August, the amount from the transaction will be available for withdrawal on 16th August, since 15th August is a trading holiday.

Click here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/intraday-trading/funds-payout-explained) for more information.

faqs.question: Why is my withdrawal amount not credited to my bank on time?
faqs.answer:
The delay in crediting your withdrawal amount can be due to the following reasons:

• Bank Delay: Angel One has approved your request, but there’s a delay at the bank’s end. Please wait for 4 hours or directly contact your bank in this case.

• New Trades: If you entered into new trades after placing the withdrawal request, it can delay the settlement and processing. Please wait for 24 hours for processing and approval.

• Non-Trading Days: Withdrawal requests are processed only on trading/working days. For example, if you placed a request at 6 pm on Thursday, and Friday and the next Monday are holidays, your funds will be credited by 11:30 am on Tuesday. Consider weekends and trading/settlement holidays when planning your withdrawal.

• High Volume of Requests: In rare cases, a high number of requests can delay processing from Angel One. Please wait for 6 hours from the cut-off time and reach out for support.

faqs.question: Why is my withdrawable balance different from the available trading balance?
faqs.answer:
The difference between your withdrawable and trading balance could be due to the following reasons. 

• When you enter a trade, your trading balance changes in real-time but the withdrawable balance is updated at the end of the day.

• Funds from sell transactions can be withdrawn on T+1 day (the next working day).

• You cannot withdraw funds on the same day you added them; you can withdraw them on the next working day.

Click here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/intraday-trading/funds-payout-explained) to get more detailed information on the same.

faqs.question: Why is my money not credited to my bank account even though the withdrawal request is approved?
faqs.answer:
If your withdrawal request is approved, it indicates that Angel One has instructed your bank to credit the amount. 

Please wait till the expected time mentioned on the app. If the time has passed, please wait for 5-6 hours. You can also check your bank statement and contact your bank.

faqs.question: Why is my withdrawal amount not credited instantly?
faqs.answer: Withdrawal requests are not credited instantly because they are processed in batches to account for any trades you might have entered on that day. These requests are processed after trading hours, considering your buy/sell transactions.

faqs.question: Why is my withdrawal request partially approved?
faqs.answer:
Your withdrawal request might be partially approved due to the following reasons:

• New Trades: You entered into new trades after placing the request. Example: If you had Rs. 1000 and placed a withdrawal request at 11 am for Rs. 1000, but then bought shares worth Rs. 500 at 2 pm, you will receive Rs. 500 (minus brokerage and charges).

• Margin Requirements: You have margin requirements in your account.

• Accrual Charges: You have pending accrual charges on your account.

Click here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/intraday-trading/funds-payout-explained) for more information.

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my fund withdrawal request?
faqs.answer:
You can follow these steps to check the status of your withdrawal request:

• Click on the Account screen in the app.

• Scroll down to the Dash section.

• Click on Fund Transactions.

• Click on Funds Withdrawn.

Click here (https://angel-one.onelink.me/JAAb/transactiondetails) to find all the fund withdrawal requests and their statuses.

faqs.question: Why am I unable to withdraw my money from my Angel One account?
faqs.answer:
You might be unable to withdraw your money for the following reasons:

• Sell Transactions: Funds from sell transactions can be withdrawn on T+1 day (the next working day). For example, if you sold shares worth Rs. 1000 on Friday, you can place a withdrawal request on Monday.

• Same-Day Deposits: Funds added to your account cannot be withdrawn on the same day; you can withdraw them on the next working day.

faqs.question: How can I withdraw funds from my Angel One account?
faqs.answer:
You can withdraw your funds from the Angel One account by following the below steps.

• Log in to your account.

• Go to the Account screen.

• Click on the “Withdraw”  button under Trading Balance at the top of the screen.

• Here you will be able to check the withdrawable amount.

• You can enter the amount you want to withdraw and the bank account to which the money needs to be credited.

• Please note the estimated credit time shown on the screen.

Kindly note that the withdrawal amount is updated every morning after taking the previous day’s transactions into account.

faqs.question: Why is my withdrawable balance less than the trading balance?
faqs.answer:
Your withdrawable balance is the amount eligible for withdrawal on a given day. Any unsettled balance from your trades will be available for withdrawal on T+1 day (next working day).

The following balances will be available for withdrawal on the next working day:

• Funds from delivery sell transactions.

• Profits from intraday transactions.

• Profits from F&O transactions.

• Funds from commodity and currency transactions.

faqs.question: Why is my withdrawable balance not updated?
faqs.answer: Your withdrawable balance is updated once every morning, after adjusting for all the transactions made on the previous trading day. This balance can be different from the trading balance, which changes in real time.

faqs.question: What are recommendations?
faqs.answer:
Recommendations are stocks suggested by Angel One to help you minimize risk and maximize profit.

You can see the recommendations by visiting https://www.angelone.in/trade/home (https://www.angelone.in/trade/home)

You will find the recommendations under “Top Stock Picks via Advisory” section on this screen.

faqs.question: What are the charges for recommendations?
faqs.answer: We don’t charge any fee for recommendations. The usual trading charges will be levied when a user takes a trade.

faqs.question: Recommend me some best growing stocks?
faqs.answer:
Angel One provides you recommendations through advisory services. Based on extensive research, we provide portfolio and single stock advisory.

To explore the more you can check Single stock advisory on the home screen of Angel 

One web or mobile platform. Here you will find suggestions for Intraday, Short and Long term stocks.

You can also explore the Portfolio advisory on the home screen if you want to buy a group of stocks.

To explore the more you can check Single stock advisory on the home screen of Angel

faqs.question: What are DP charges at Angel One?
faqs.answer:
Depository Participant (DP) charges are combined charges imposed by CDSL and Angel One on every sell transaction of equity delivery shares. Please note that DP charges are not applicable on intraday trades or delivery buy transactions. The details are as below.

Equity delivery: Rs. 20+GST per sale transaction, split as below.

(Male – INR 3.5 (CDSL) + INR 16.5 (Angel One Charge))

(Female – INR 3.25 (CDSL) + INR 16.75 (Angle One Charge))

For example,

If you sell 100 shares of TCS on Monday at 10 am and again sell 50 shares later in the day, DP charges will be applicable twice. The total DP charges levied in this case will be Rs. 47.2.

faqs.question: What is Account Maintenance Charge (AMC) at Angel One?
faqs.answer:
Account Maintenance Charge (AMC) is a fixed quarterly charge that is billed to your account. 

Account maintenance charges for the first year are 0. However, the following are the charges for customers from 2nd year onwards.

• Non-BSDA (Basic Services Demat Account) Clients – Rs. 60+ GST billed every quarter (Charged after your first trade each quarter).

• For BSDA Clients – 

If the holding value is less than 4 lakh, AMC is 0.

If the holding value is between 4 lakh and 10 lakh, AMC is Rs. 100+GST billed every year.

You can check the AMC levied to your account by navigating to Account → Trades and Charges → Other Charges screen on the app.

faqs.question: Where can I check the Account Maintenance Charges levied to my account?
faqs.answer: You can easily check the AMC charges levied to your account in the Angel One app. Please visit Account → Trades and Charges → Other Charges screen and select the desired data range to check the AMC charges.

faqs.question: How much is the account maintenance charge on Angel One?
faqs.answer:
Account maintenance charges for the first year are 0. However, the following are the charges for customers from 2nd year onwards.

• Non-BSDA (Basic Services Demat Account) Clients – Rs. 60+ GST billed every quarter (Charged after your first trade each quarter).

For BSDA Clients –

If the holding value is less than 4 lakh, AMC is 0.

If the holding value is between 4 lakh and 10 lakh, AMC is Rs. 100+GST billed every year.

You can check the AMC levied to your account by navigating to Account → Trades and Charges → Other Charges screen on the app.

faqs.question: What are BSDA and non-BSDA accounts?
faqs.answer:
BSDA (Basic Services Demat Account)

BSDA accounts provide limited services at a lower cost to retail account holders. Your account will be automatically a BSDA if it fulfills both the below conditions.

• You have only 1 Demat account across all stock brokers.

• The value of holdings in your account is less than 10 lakh.

Non-BSDA

Accounts that do not fulfill the above-mentioned criteria of BSDA are categorized as Non-BSDA.

faqs.question: Where can I check my BSDA status?
faqs.answer: You can check your BSDA status in client master list (CML). However, we don’t have a facility to download the CML from our platform. We are working on making it available to you soon.

faqs.question: What are the charges for Auto Square Off?
faqs.answer: The charges for Auto Square Off are Rs 20 per executed order.

faqs.question: When will I get my brokerage cashback?
faqs.answer:
Brokerage Discount is offered to certain new customers for the first month only. Below are the Terms & Conditions:

• This is a one-time and exclusive offer for new customers and might not apply to all users. 

• The validity of free brokerage is 30 days on all trades from the date of account opening, with an upper limit of ₹500.

• Brokerage will not be charged; it will simply be discounted if applicable on a certain trade.

Please note: Angel One reserves the right, in its absolute discretion, to change, alter or discontinue the offer and shall communicate the same to the client via email.

faqs.question: How can I check brokerage and other charges in my Angel One account?
faqs.answer: You can check the charges by clicking ‘Trades & Charges’ on the ‘Account Section’ of the app. Here, you can see both trade and non-trade charges (including charges by Angel One and external charges). Click here (https://www.angelone.in/exchange-transaction-charges) to know more about all the applicable charges.

faqs.question: What are the brokerage charges for different securities?
faqs.answer:
Equity delivery: From 1 November 2024, Angel One charges brokerage of ₹20 or 0.1% per executed order whichever is lower (minimum brokerage of ₹2) for equity delivery trades. 

Equity intraday: For equity intraday, a brokerage charge of ₹20 or 0.03% per executed order whichever is lower will be applicable.

Futures and Options: For F&O, ₹20 per executed order will be applicable as brokerage.

Please click here (https://www.angelone.in/exchange-transaction-charges) to view all the latest charges applicable to your trades.

faqs.question: How can I see today’s charges?
faqs.answer:
The charges for today’s trades will be updated in your account after 1-2 working days. This is because, the charges from regulators or external charges are settled at the end of trading day. Angel One receives those charge details from regulators and updates them in a couple of days.

You will be able to check the charges by visiting Account → Trades & Charges screen on the platform.

faqs.question: Are there any brokerage charges on delivery trades?
faqs.answer: From 1 November 2024, brokerage charges for equity delivery trades will be levied at flat INR 20 or 0.1%+ GST whichever is lower per executed order (minimum brokerage of INR 2 will be levied).

faqs.question: Why do I see charges on delivery trades? I thought it was free.
faqs.answer:
From 1 November 2024, brokerage charges for equity delivery trades will be levied at flat INR 20 or 0.1%+ GST whichever is lower per executed order (minimum brokerage of INR 2 will be levied).

Additionally, there will be regulatory charges such as STT, GST, Stamp duty, etc. charged by the exchanges. These charges are the same for all trading platforms.

You can see what Angel One charged you by visiting Account → Trades and charges → Total charges or View the detailed charges screen on the Angel One platform.

faqs.question: Are there any charges on using Trade One feature?
faqs.answer: No, Trade One feature is completely free.

faqs.question: How can I know my brokerage plan?
faqs.answer: You can check your brokerage plan in the Angel app. Navigate to the Account → Profile → Brokerage & Charges screen on the app. You will be able to see your brokerage plan and corresponding charges here.

faqs.question: What is my current brokerage plan?
faqs.answer: You can check your brokerage plan in the Angel app. Navigate to the Account → Profile → Brokerage & Charges screen on the app. You will be able to see your brokerage plan and corresponding charges here.

faqs.question: What are Call & Trade Charges?
faqs.answer:
Call & Trade charges are applicable if the transaction is done over a phone call.

Charges for Call & Trade are Rs 20+GST per executed Order.

They are levied only after the execution of a trade.

faqs.question: What are DP charges at Angel One?
faqs.answer:
Depository Participant (DP) charges are combined charges imposed by CDSL and Angel One on every sell transaction of equity delivery shares. Please note that DP charges are not applicable on intraday trades or delivery buy transactions. The details are as below.

Equity delivery: Rs. 20+GST per sale transaction, split as below.

(Male – INR 3.5 (CDSL) + INR 16.5 (Angel One Charge))

(Female – INR 3.25 (CDSL) + INR 16.75 (Angle One Charge))

For example,

If you sell 100 shares of TCS on Monday at 10 am and again sell 50 shares later in the day, DP charges will be applicable twice. The total DP charges levied in this case will be Rs. 47.2.

faqs.question: What are DP Charges?
faqs.answer:
DP(Depository Participant) charges are applied at the time of selling shares from your DEMAT account.

DP Charges are levied on a per-scrip, per-transaction basis. They don’t depend on the quantity of shares you sold, but on the number of different scrips/shares/securities that you sell.

DP Charges are levied at Rs 20 (+ 18% GST) per scrip per transaction.

faqs.question: When are DP Charges levied?
faqs.answer: DP Charges are levied whenever you sell equity delivery shares from your Angel One account. They are not applicable to equity buy, intraday, or F&O transactions. DP Charges are levied on a per-scrip basis and do not depend on the quantity or the units sold.

faqs.question: What is Goods & Service tax (GST) invoice?
faqs.answer: Stock brokers provide broking service, and hence are liable to pay Goods & Services tax, which is covered in the GST invoice

faqs.question: What is the GST rate?
faqs.answer: The GST rate for Stock broking service is 18%.

faqs.question: What are Off-MKT transactions charges?
faqs.answer: Off-MKT transactions charges are applicable when you transfer shares from one demat account to another

faqs.question: What are the charges for Off-MKT transactions?
faqs.answer:
Off-MKT transactions are a flat transaction fee of Rs 20 (+GST).

This fee is charged per scrip and notas per volume.

Hence, they remain the same whether you transfer 1 share or 100 shares.

faqs.question: What is the duration of Off-MKT charges?
faqs.answer: Off-MKT charges are charged on a daily basis whenever you transfer any scrip from your demat account to another demat account.

faqs.question: What are Penal/Delayed payment charges?
faqs.answer: Delayed Payment Charges (DPC) are the charges levied to clients; on the overall ledger debit from Trading day +2.

faqs.question: What are the charges for Delayed payment?
faqs.answer: Delayed Payment charges are billed at an interest rate of 18% p.a on the debit amount.

faqs.question: When will Delayed payment charges (DPC) be charged to me?
faqs.answer:
Delayed payment charges on the debit amount will be charged to you on a daily basis.

However the same will be updated in your ledger every 15 days.

faqs.question: Where can I check the breakup of the Interest charged to me?
faqs.answer:
Tap on Account at the bottom of your screen.

Click on Statement

Click on the transaction in which Interest is charged

Click on View details to see the Interest charges break-up for your account

faqs.question: What are the charges for pledging of shares?
faqs.answer:
Pledging of shares is charged a flat transaction fee, irrespective of the quantity pledged. A fixed transaction fee of ₹20 + GST is charged for each pledge and unpledge request, regardless of the number of shares. The split is as follows.

INR 5 (Depository) + INR 15 (Angel One Charge) + GST

faqs.question: What are SEBI Charges?
faqs.answer: SEBI charges are fees levied by SEBI for sale and purchase transactions in all types of securities.

faqs.question: What are Stamp Duty charges?
faqs.answer: Stamp duty is a direct tax levied on trading in stocks, currency derivatives and commodities, payable under Section 3 of the Indian Stamp Act, 1899.

faqs.question: What are the charges for pledging and unpledging shares?
faqs.answer:
A fixed transaction fee of ₹20 + GST is charged for each pledge and unpledge request, regardless of the number of shares. The split is as follows.

INR 5 (Depository) + INR 15 (Angel One Charge) + GST

For example,

Suppose you want to pledge 100 shares of ABC Ltd. and 50 shares of XYZ Ltd. You will be charged ₹40 + GST for 2 requests, irrespective of the number of shares in each request.

Similarly, if you want to place one unpledge request for 100 shares of ABC Ltd. and two unpledge requests for 50 shares and 20 shares of XYZ Ltd, respectively. In this case, you will be charged (₹20 x 3) = ₹60 + GST for 3 requests, irrespective of the number of shares in each request.

faqs.question: What are Securities Transaction Tax?
faqs.answer:
Securities Transaction Tax is a direct tax charged on the purchase and sale of securities that are listed on stock exchanges.

Buy and Sale of equity delivery shares: 0.1% per executed order

Sale of equity intraday shares: 0.025% per executed order

Sale of futures in securities: STT shall be revised to 0.02% from 0.0125%

Sale of options in securities: STT shall be revised to 0.1% of premium from 0.0625%

faqs.question: What are transaction/turnover charges?
faqs.answer: Transaction/Turnover charges are charges that are levied by the Exchange on the turnover from every trader to provide them with the technology platform to buy & sell securities. Click here (https://www.angelone.in/exchange-transaction-charges) to check the details on transaction charges.

faqs.question: Why are my drawings not getting retained on charts?
faqs.answer: All Drawings under templates are stored inside the local storage. If you login through other devices you won’t be able to view previously saved drawings on other device/browser.

faqs.question: Where to find Drawing tools on charts?
faqs.answer: On Web or on Mobile platforms, click on blue arrow button that is present on left side of the charts – by clicking on it, it will give an expanded view of the drawing tools available

faqs.question: How to interpret Boring and Explosive Indicators?
faqs.answer:
Absolute (OpenPrice – ClosePrice) / Absolute (HighPrice – LowPrice) < 0.5, Colour it as Boring Candle

Absolute (OpenPrice – ClosePrice) / Absolute (HighPrice – LowPrice) > 0.5, Colour it as Explosive Candle

If the value = 0.5 , do not change the candle colour

faqs.question: How to interpret ORB Indicator?
faqs.answer: Opening Range Breakout – Opening Range is high and low price range of the 1st candle in Intraday period specified. Any Following candle after that first candle breaking the upper range is Buy Signal and breaking the lower range is Sell signal.

faqs.question: How to interpret settings for Bollinger Bands?
faqs.answer:
Bollinger Bands are a technical analysis tool used by traders and investors to help interpret and analyze price volatility and potential price reversals in financial markets.

You can check out how to interpret Bollinger Bands in this article (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/online-share-trading/bollinger-bands).

faqs.question: Is multi chart view available on both - web & mobile?

faqs.question: How to use Multi Chart functionality on Angel One web app?

faqs.question: How do I compare multiple scrip/contract on the chart view?
faqs.answer:
Multi Chart View Guide – We have introduced Multiple chart layout in our web app view as of now.

Users can select the multiple chart layout from the select layout icon on the chart header. When we will select any scrip , it will get populated on the selected frame.

Users can then compare different compare different scrip on a multi chart view.

faqs.question: Is multi chart functionality free or paid?
faqs.answer: Multi chart feature is absolutely free on Angel One.

faqs.question: What are the different Charts interface available on Angel One?
faqs.answer:
Android and IOS mobile app: Chart IQ and Trading View

Web: Trading View only

faqs.question: How to interchange between Chart IQ and Trading View chart in Mobile App?
faqs.answer: On the Android and iOS mobile version, you can simply go to Account > Settings > Scroll down to Charts and choose between ChartIQ or TradingView. Note that you can change the chart version only on the mobile version and not the web application.

faqs.question: Chart Price scale is changed to logarithmic values. How can i change it back to default settings?
faqs.answer:
Follow these steps to adjust your price scale to regular:

1. Open the chart and check the price scale on the right-hand side of the chart.

2. Below it, you will find a settings icon (shaped like a sun).

3. Click this settings icon.

4. Thereafter, a menu with different options will appear.

5. Click on ‘Regular’ to bring the price scale back to the default setting.

faqs.question: Where can I find Chart IQ?
faqs.answer:
On the Angel One mobile app, you can find the Chart IQ interface by going to Account > Settings > Scroll down to Charts and choose ChartIQ. Please note that you can change the chart version only on the mobile version and not on the web app.

We are working on making ChartIQ available on Web as well.

faqs.question: Is Chart IQ available on web?
faqs.answer: No, Chart IQ is not available on web as of today. Chart IQ is available only on mobile app. We are working on making it available to you on web soon.

faqs.question: How to use Trade From Charts functionality on Angel One web app?
faqs.answer: Please find the details of Trade from Charts functionality in this article (https://www.angelone.in/blog/now-trade-assets-and-track-orders-directly-from-charts-on-the-angel-one-web-app).

faqs.question: How to track open orders and positions on charts ?
faqs.answer: Please visit this link (https://www.angelone.in/blog/now-track-modify-orders-and-positions-directly-from-charts-on-the-angel-one-web-app) for detailed guidance on tracking open orders and positions on charts

faqs.question: How to place Direct and Instant Orders on charts ?
faqs.answer: Please refer to this article (https://www.angelone.in/blog/instant-order-placement-on-our-web-app-charts-is-revolutionising-fo-trading).

faqs.question: What is a surveillance measure?
faqs.answer: Market surveillance plays a key role in ensuring safety and integrity of the markets as it the process of prevention and investigation of abusive, manipulative or illegal trading practices in the securities markets. Surveillance Measure is an initative by the regulatory bodies and exchanges to protect traders and investors by monitoring price and volatility and detecting misleading activities like insider trading, fictitious transactions, and more.

faqs.question: What is ASM?
faqs.answer: SEBI (Securities and Exchange Board of India) along with the stock exchanges have initiated an Additional Surveillance Measure or ASM to safeguard investors’ interests by ensuring there are no market speculations or manipulations like unexpected price movements. The stocks are categorized under ASM for surveillance based on criteria specified by NSE here (https://www.nseindia.com/regulations/exchange-market-surveillance-actions).

faqs.question: What is GSM?
faqs.answer: GSM or Graded Surveillance Measure is a system used by Indian Stock Exchanges like NSE and BSE to alert traders/investors and ask them to be extra cautious while dealing in certain securities which have been categorized under GSM. Scrips can be classified under GSM due to abnormal price hike that doesn’t match with the company’s financial health, are illiquid, have negligible market capital, and are underpreforming.

faqs.question: What is the difference between ASM and GSM?
faqs.answer: The main aim of the ASM framework is to control stock volatility, while the primary objective of GSM is to protect the investors from underperforming stocks by not allowing intraday trading and to advise them to be extra vigilant while dealing with securities that are witnessing unusual price fluctuations. Both these frameworks are introduced with different objectives, but their main goal is to protect traders and investors.

faqs.question: What is the basis of categorizing a scrip under ASM?
faqs.answer:
SEBI and Exchanges jointly decides the objective criterion to shortlist securities under ASM based on the following parameters:

1. High Low Variation

2. Client Concentration

3. Close to Close Price Variation

4. Market Capitalization

5. Volume Variation

6. Delivery Percentage

7. No. of Unique PANs & PEs

faqs.question: When will a scrip be classified under GSM?
faqs.answer:
On the basis of below-mentioned pointers, Regulatory Body and the Exchanges make their decision of adding a scrip under GSM category:

1. Periodic Call Auction Session for Illiquid Securities

2. Periodic Review of Movement of Securities to/from Trade for Trade

3. Persistent Noise Creators

4. Rumour Verification and Clarification in case of Spurt in Price/Volume

faqs.question: When will a scrip get out of ASM/GSM?
faqs.answer: Every 2 months in the case of ASM and every quarter in the case of GSM, the stock can go in and out of the list based on the review carried out by the exchange.

faqs.question: What are the surveillance measures under ASM?
faqs.answer: Please find the detailed surveillance measures under ASM here (https://static.nseindia.com/s3fs-public/inline-files/FAQs%20-%20Additional%20Surveillance%20Measure%20%28ASM%29.pdf).

faqs.question: Where can we see the complete list of securities under ASM/GSM?
faqs.answer:
The ASM and GSM lists change from time to time. You can see or download the current securities list from the table below.

Exchange
Category

ASM Stocks (https://www.nseindia.com/reports/asm)

NSE

faqs.question: Does Angel One allow buying and selling of scrips under ASM and GSM?
faqs.answer: Yes, we allow buying and selling of scrips under ASM and GSM, owing to certain rules and regulations. At Angel, trading is allowed in ASM scrips, while in the case of GSM, only scrips categorised under 0 and 1 are allowed for trading.

faqs.question: Why is a particular scrip or scrips blocked from trading?
faqs.answer: To safeguard the clients from undue loss arising due to monitoring price and volatility and detecting misleading activities such as insider trading, fictitious transactions, and more, particular scrip and scrips are blocked from trading.

faqs.question: How much margin is charged for ASM/GSM scrip?
faqs.answer:
The applicable margin while placing orders for ASM/GSM scrip will be 100% in all stages while the price band fluctuates.

For GSM: In Stage 1, the applicable margin shall be 100%, while, from Stage 2 onwards, an Additional Surveillance Deposit of 50% or 100% will be applicable based on GSM stage.

Note: Please know that clients will not be able to buy stocks that are in stage 2 of GSM or higher. These stocks will require Additional Surveillance Deposit (ASD) of 100% of the trade value or more and this margin will remain blocked by the exchange atleast for 2 months even after the stock is solid.

faqs.question: Can I trade in scrips categorized as unsolicited?
faqs.answer: No, trading in unsolicited scrips is restricted at Angel One. Click here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/share-market/unsolicited-investment-tips) to know more unsolicited investment tips.

faqs.question: What are Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC) and Inter Creditor Agreement (ICA)? What happens when a stock is under the surveillance of either of these codes?
faqs.answer:
Insolvency Bankruptcy Code (IBC):

This law is incorporated to handle insolvency and bankruptcy cases. When a stock is under surveillance for IBC, it means the company is going through an insolvency procedure. For some of these stocks, trading may still be allowed subject to the stage of surveillance.
Inter Creditor Agreement (ICA):

An agreement between various lenders and a single borrower that describes their rights and obligations in case of a default is ICA. When a company has entered into ICA to restructure the debt, its stock comes under the surveillance. In these cases, trading in the stocks might be allowed but with certain restrictions in place.

faqs.question: Why are some scrips blocked from trading in Options?
faqs.answer: Trading is resticted for certain scrips to protect clients from undue loss arising due to liquid counters.

faqs.question: Why am I unable to buy/sell SME shares?
faqs.answer: If the client has bought SME shares through IPO, selling is allowed. However, buying is completely blocked as per the risk and management decision to safeguard clients from undue losses occuring due to liquid counters.

faqs.question: Why am I allowed to buy/sell limited quantity?
faqs.answer: Buying/selling is limited to a particular quantity due to illiquid counters and dry volumes. This restriction also safeguards clients from excess losses.

faqs.question: Why are certain scrips allowed to trade only 2 times in a financial year?
faqs.answer: This criteria is removed from Angel One.

faqs.question: Why do I need to verify my mobile number?
faqs.answer: Verifying your mobile number helps us create a secure account for you, ensuring a smooth app experience and the safety of your account.

faqs.question: Can I continue if the mobile number linked to my bank is different from the one registered with the app?
faqs.answer: No, your details, including your mobile number, must match those verified by our banking partner. A mismatch will result in your application being rejected by the bank.

faqs.question: Why are permissions to send SMS and access phone state required?
faqs.answer: These permissions are needed to verify your mobile number by sending an SMS. Rest assured, these permissions are used solely for verification purposes.

faqs.question: Can I link any SIM for FD purchase if I have a dual SIM phone?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can. However, we recommend using the SIM registered with your bank account for authentication.

faqs.question: Can I retry the registration if it was not successful earlier?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can retry. Ensure you use the SIM linked to your bank account for authentication.

faqs.question: Can I invest in FD if I do not have a PAN?
faqs.answer: No, currently, we only process fixed deposit requests for individuals with an active PAN.

faqs.question: Why is my PAN not getting verified?
faqs.answer: For booking fixed deposits, we need to verify your PAN with the regulated authorities. If there is a mismatch, the booking cannot be completed.

faqs.question: What should I do if the name shown against my PAN is incorrect and I can't update it?
faqs.answer: The name linked to your PAN should be accurate for successful identity verification and KYC purposes. Please update your name to match your PAN.

faqs.question: Why is my Aadhar required?
faqs.answer: Aadhar is mandatory for identification and KYC setup for your account, necessary for processing your FD request.

faqs.question: Do I need a physical copy of my Aadhar?
faqs.answer: No, a physical copy is not required. We use secure platforms like DigiLocker and CKYC for verifying your Aadhar and other documents.

faqs.question: What is DigiLocker?
faqs.answer: DigiLocker is a government initiative under the Digital India project for storing and verifying documents like PAN card, driving license, Aadhar card, school marksheets, and insurance papers.

faqs.question: What should I do if there's a name mismatch and I can't complete the step?
faqs.answer: For successful FD booking, the name on your Aadhar and PAN should match. Correct the details on either your PAN or Aadhar card and retry.

faqs.question: How can I add a new address as my current address?
faqs.answer: Use the “add” button on the address choice screen to add an address that is not listed.

faqs.question: What should I do if I can't change my permanent address?
faqs.answer: The address from your Aadhar is considered your permanent address. You may add or select your current address to proceed with the FD application.

faqs.question: Can my permanent address be the same as my current address?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can select your permanent address as your current address if they are the same.

faqs.question: Why is video KYC required?
faqs.answer: Video KYC is required to complete the KYC verification step as mandated by the RBI.

faqs.question: What if I am not available during bank working hours?
faqs.answer: If you have made the payment, we will notify you when the bank officers are available. If video KYC is not completed within 3 days, your money will be refunded to your bank account.

faqs.question: When can I complete the Video KYC?
faqs.answer: Video KYC is available from Monday to Saturday, 09:00 AM to 08:00 PM. We will notify you to complete the video KYC during these hours if pending.

faqs.question: What if video KYC fails?
faqs.answer: You can retry during banking hours within 2 days of FD booking if your video KYC fails.

faqs.question: How will I know the status of my video KYC?
faqs.answer: Your video KYC details are verified by bank officers, which may take up to 3 hours. Track the video KYC and FD confirmation status on the ‘My Investments’ tab.

faqs.question: What should I do if I can't move to the next step and complete my KYC verification?
faqs.answer: Retry using the correct details. If it still doesn’t work, try again later. If the issue persists, raise a ticket with our support team for assistance.

faqs.question: Why are details related to occupation, income, and family required for FD booking?
faqs.answer: These details are required by the bank to create your fixed deposit and ensure communication if needed.

faqs.question: Why is my money deducted before video KYC?
faqs.answer: Your money is deducted before video KYC as it is the last step to verify your identity and book your FD. Your money is safe with the bank, and interest starts accumulating from the time of payment. In case of issues with VKYC, your money will be refunded within 7 working days.

faqs.answer: Keep your PAN Card and a blank paper with a pen ready for the VKYC process.

faqs.answer: Your money is deducted before video KYC as it is the last step to verify your identity and book your FD. Your money is safe with the bank, and interest starts accumulating from the time of payment. In case of issues with VKYC, your money will be refunded within 7 working days.

faqs.question: What is required for completing a video KYC?
faqs.answer: Keep your PAN Card and a blank paper with a pen ready for the VKYC process.

faqs.question: How can I avoid giving the required consents?
faqs.answer: To ensure a smooth and secure onboarding process, we require certain permissions to fetch and validate your personal details and for KYC purposes. These permissions are only used for account creation and validation.

faqs.question: How safe is it to share my data using consents?
faqs.answer: Your data is only used for account creation and KYC purposes, and it is not shared with any third parties. The safety of your information is our top priority.

faqs.question: What is CKYC, and why do I need to consent to fetch CKYC data?
faqs.answer: CKYC stands for Central KYC (Know Your Customer), an initiative by the Government of India to streamline the KYC process by making all relevant information available in one place. With your consent, we can access this information for a faster and safer onboarding experience.

faqs.question: What details will be accessed from Digilocker for FD booking?
faqs.answer: We will use the Digilocker facility to validate your identity and complete KYC by verifying documents like Aadhar and PAN.

faqs.question: Can I open a Fixed Deposit if I am an Indian citizen but not a tax resident of India?
faqs.answer: Currently, we can only process fixed deposit requests for users who are tax residents of India.

faqs.question: What is a tax resident of India?
faqs.answer:
A person is considered a resident of India if they have spent either:

• 182 days or more in India during the financial year, or

• 365 days or more in India during the four preceding years and 60 days or more during the current financial year.

faqs.question: How can I book another FD if I already have one running?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can invest in multiple Fixed Deposits (FDs) with different providers. You can also have multiple FDs with the same provider.

faqs.question: What additional benefits can I avail as a senior citizen?
faqs.answer: Most banks and NBFCs offer an additional interest rate of up to 0.5% over the regular fixed deposit interest rates for senior citizens, making it even more attractive for you.

faqs.question: Can I book an FD as an NRI?
faqs.answer: Currently, we are not able to process fixed deposit requests for NRIs.

faqs.question: Can I book an FD as a minor?
faqs.answer: Currently, we are not able to process fixed deposit requests for minors.

faqs.question: What is a fixed deposit and why should I invest?
faqs.answer: A fixed deposit (FD) is a popular and safe investment option in India. You invest a lump sum of money at an agreed interest rate and receive the amount along with interest upon maturity. The interest rates are fixed, higher than a regular savings account, and the investment is protected from market fluctuations.

faqs.question: Is it safe to invest in an FD?
faqs.answer: Yes, FDs are one of the safest investment options. Unlike market-led investments where returns fluctuate, the returns on an FD are fixed at the time of investment. Even if FD interest rates change over time, your FD will grow at the rate you initially booked.

faqs.question: What is DICGC and which deposits are secured by them?
faqs.answer: The Deposit Insurance and Credit Guarantee Corporation (DICGC) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). It insures bank deposits, including savings, current, recurring, and fixed deposits, up to Rs. 5 lakh per account holder per bank. This insurance does not cover FDs with NBFCs.

faqs.question: Can only banks offer fixed deposits?
faqs.answer: No, fixed deposits are offered by banks, NBFCs, and the India Post Office. FDs with NBFCs, known as Corporate FDs, often offer higher interest rates compared to banks.

faqs.question: What is an NBFC and do they also offer fixed deposits?
faqs.answer: A Non-Banking Financial Corporation (NBFC) operates as a financial institution without a full banking license, regulated by the Ministry of Corporate Affairs and the Reserve Bank of India. NBFCs offer services like savings, investment plans, lending schemes, insurance, and fixed deposits.

faqs.question: What is the minimum and maximum amount I can invest in a fixed deposit?
faqs.answer: You can start investing in fixed deposits with a minimum amount as low as INR 5000. The maximum amount varies based on the specific FD scheme you choose.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to add a nominee?
faqs.answer: No, it is not mandatory to add a nominee, but it is recommended.

faqs.question: Can I add a nominee who is less than 18 years old?
faqs.answer: Yes, but you must provide the details of a guardian.

faqs.question: Who can I add as a nominee?
faqs.answer: You can add any individual as a nominee, including family members, relatives, friends, or any trusted person.

faqs.question: Can I add or change a nominee later?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can add or change a nominee later, but this service is currently available only with some partner banks. You will see the “Add Nominee” option on the dashboard once your FD is successfully booked.

faqs.question: What is FD advice?
faqs.answer: FD advice is a computer-generated statement provided by the bank as proof of ownership or investment when you open a fixed deposit.

faqs.question: I do not file taxes. Is there a way for TDS to not get deducted from the FD?
faqs.answer: Currently, we do not offer a solution to avoid TDS deduction. Some banks allow the filing of forms 15G/15H, but we do not have this functionality. TDS is deducted only if the total interest from all sources with the bank exceeds Rs 40,000 for normal citizens and Rs 50,000 for senior citizens.

faqs.question: How are FDs taxed?
faqs.answer: Interest earnings from your fixed deposit are taxed according to your tax slab. For example, if you are in the 20% tax bracket and you earned Rs 6,000 interest from a 1-year FD of Rs 1 lakh at 6%, you will pay 20% of Rs 6,000, which is Rs 1,200, as tax.

faqs.question: What is a payout account?
faqs.answer: A payout account is where your fixed deposit investments will be credited upon maturity. This is the account where you will receive your money back.

faqs.question: Can I add someone else's bank account details?
faqs.answer: No, the payout account should belong to you. We do not allow the use of another person’s account for payout. Please use an account that is in your name.

faqs.question: How can I add my bank if it is not in the list?
faqs.answer: Click on the Search tab, enter your bank name, and you will be able to select your bank to add as the payout account for your fixed deposit.

faqs.question: What should I do if my bank is inactive but my bank details are correct?
faqs.answer: Your payout account must be an active bank account for us to credit the money on maturity or withdrawal. If your bank status is inactive, either add another active bank account or check with your bank regarding your account status.

faqs.question: Why did I receive an SMS of INR 1 credit?
faqs.answer: We verify your bank account by transferring INR 1. This verification process might result in an SMS from your bank informing you about the credit.

faqs.question: What should I do if the bank servers are down?
faqs.answer: Retry after some time or use a different bank account.

faqs.question: What if my payment fails?
faqs.answer: If your payment fails and the amount is deducted, it will be refunded within 2-4 working days. You can place another request for an FD if you are still interested.

faqs.question: Why did my payment fail?
faqs.answer: Third-party limit error: Check your daily online transaction limit in your net banking, as exceeding this limit will cause the transaction to fail. UPI limit error: UPI transactions have a daily limit of Rs 1 lakh. Ensure you are not exceeding this limit. Bank connection error: Sometimes the connection to your bank’s page or UPI app page may break during payment, causing the transaction to fail.

faqs.question: What should I do if I haven't received the refund yet?
faqs.answer: Your money is safe. If you haven’t received the refund within 7 working days, check your bank account statement for refund transactions and ensure 7 working days have passed.

faqs.question: What should I do if I am stuck on the payment step and cannot understand the current status?
faqs.answer: Click on “Go to Dashboard” to track your FDs in the Pending Investments tab.

faqs.question: What interest rate will I get in case of a premature withdrawal?
faqs.answer: For premature withdrawal, the interest rate applicable will be for the tenure the FD was maintained. A penalty rate will also apply, and the net off penalty rate will be the applicable interest rate.

faqs.question: When and where will I receive my money in case of a withdrawal?
faqs.answer: You will receive your money within 2 working days after successfully placing withdrawal instructions to the account details provided during the FD booking process.

faqs.question: Are there any withdrawal processing charges?
faqs.answer: No, there are no withdrawal processing charges.

faqs.question: How will I know when my withdrawal is completed?
faqs.answer: You will receive an SMS or notification from the bank regarding the crediting of money in your account. The FD booking will be automatically removed post-withdrawal.

faqs.question: Can I prematurely withdraw my FD?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can prematurely withdraw your Fixed Deposit with Axis Bank and Utkarsh Bank once the lock-in period is completed.

faqs.question: What should I do if my payment was complete, but the FD status is not showing complete?
faqs.answer: It can take some time for the bank to verify your application. You will receive an SMS notification once the FD is approved, which can take up to 24 hours. You can also track the status on the app dashboard.

faqs.question: I haven't received the FD advice yet. Where will it get delivered?
faqs.answer: The FD advice is usually delivered to your registered email ID within 7 days of successful FD booking. This document is directly shared by the bank.

faqs.question: Where can I see my ongoing investments?
faqs.answer: You can access your ongoing investments on the ‘My Investments’ page under the Ongoing Investments tab.

faqs.question: Why is my FD rejected?
faqs.answer: The FD may be rejected due to a discrepancy in the information provided. You can retry with the correct details.

faqs.question: Why is my trading balance not updated even after adding funds successfully?
faqs.answer:
If your trading balance is not updated after a successful fund addition, it could be due to the following reasons:

• High Volume of Requests: When there is a high volume of fund addition requests, it might take some time to update your balance. Please wait for 15 minutes.

• Bank Account Issues: Ensure you add funds from the bank account registered with Angel One, and the account should be in your name. If funds are added from an unregistered bank account, the amount might get deducted but will be credited back in 3-4 working days.

faqs.question: Why am I unable to add funds to my Angel One account?
faqs.answer:
You might be unable to add funds to your Angel One account due to the following reasons:

• Unregistered Bank Account: You might be trying to add funds from a bank account not registered with your Angel One account.

• Incorrect UPI ID: The UPI ID used for fund addition might not be mapped to the bank account registered with Angel One.

Ensure you add funds from your bank account registered with Angel One.

faqs.question: Why am I unable to add funds using UPI?
faqs.answer:
You might be unable to add funds via UPI due to the following reasons:

• Bank Account Mismatch: The bank account linked with Angel One is different from the one selected in the UPI app.

• Unregistered UPI ID: आपकी UPI आईडी एक ऐसे बैंक खाते से मैप की गई है जो एंजेल वन के साथ पंजीकृत नहीं है.

• Timeout: ऐप पर आपका UPI अनुरोध 10 मिनट के भीतर स्वीकार नहीं किया गया.

• Transfer Limit Exceeded: आपके बैंक द्वारा निर्धारित आपकी UPI स्थानांतरण सीमा समाप्त हो गई है.

• Daily Limit Reached: Your daily UPI transaction limit is reached across all UPI apps.

• Insufficient Balance: आपके बैंक खाते में अपर्याप्त शेष राशि हो सकती है.

• Network Issues: Network failure at the bank’s/provider’s system.

• Incorrect UPI ID: आपकी दर्ज की गई यूपीआई आईडी (वीपीए) गलत है.

• Wrong UPI PIN: You have entered the wrong UPI PIN.

• Incorrect Method: You are transferring funds to Angel One’s UPI ID directly instead of using the ‘धन जोड़ें’ option on the Angel One app/platform.

Ensure you follow the correct procedure and check the above points to resolve the issue.

faqs.question: Why am I unable to add funds using net banking?
faqs.answer:
You might be unable to add funds via net banking due to the following reasons:

• Unregistered Bank Account: You are making payments from a bank account that is not registered with Angel One.

• Mismatched Bank Details: You have added different bank account details on the ‘धन जोड़ें’ page and net banking page.

• Incorrect Credentials: You have entered incorrect credentials on the bank’s net banking page.

• Insufficient Balance: लेन-देन करने के लिए आपके बैंक खाते में पर्याप्त शेष राशि नहीं है.

• Transaction Limits: Your bank has placed limits on your transaction amount or the number of transactions.

• Network Failure: There may be a network failure at the bank’s or provider’s system.

Ensure you check these points and follow the correct procedure to add funds via net banking.

faqs.question: What are the different options available to add funds to my Angel One account?
faqs.answer:
You can add funds using any of the following options.

• Add funds using payment apps such as PhonePe, Google Pay, etc.

• Add funds using UPI ID.

• Add funds using net banking.

Please make sure to add funds from your bank account registered with Angel One in all the above options.

faqs.question: Can I add funds from any bank account to my Angel One account?
faqs.answer: No, you can add funds only from your bank account registered with Angel One. This is in accordance with SEBI guidelines. You cannot add funds from a bank account that belongs to your spouse, friend, or anyone else.

faqs.question: How to add funds to my Angel One account?
faqs.answer:
You can add funds online to your Angel One account by following these steps:

• Tap on Account at the bottom of your screen.

• Click on धन जोड़ें.

• Enter the amount and choose the mode of transfer (Google Pay, PhonePe, other UPI methods, or Net banking).

• Follow the subsequent steps to authorize your transaction, and the funds will be added to your account.

Click here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/trading-account/add-funds-the-digital-way) for more details on adding funds.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to add funds via bank account registered with Angel One?
faqs.answer: Yes, as per regulatory guidelines and compliance norms, it is mandatory to transfer funds through the bank accounts registered with Angel One.

faqs.question: Why is my amount debited from bank but not added to my trading balance?
faqs.answer:
If the amount is debited from the bank but not added to your Angel One balance, it could be due to the following reasons:

• Unregistered Bank Account: You might have tried to add funds from an unregistered bank account. The debited amount will be credited back to your bank in 3-4 working days.

• Technical Glitch: There could be a technical glitch at your bank’s end. The debited amount will be refunded in 3-4 working days.

faqs.question: Can I use debit/credit card to add funds to my Angel One account?
faqs.answer: आप अपने डेबिट या क्रेडिट कार्ड का उपयोग करके अपने एंजेल वन खाते में धनराशि नहीं जोड़ सकते। नियामक दिशानिर्देशों के अनुसार, आपका लेनदेन सत्यापित बैंक खाते से होना चाहिए। साथ ही, शेयर बाज़ारों में क्रेडिट कार्ड के उपयोग की अनुमति नहीं है।

faqs.question: क्या मेरे एंजेल वन खाते में धनराशि जोड़ने की कोई सीमा है?
faqs.answer:
• The limit for fund addition via UPI is 1 lakh per day.

• For net banking, the limit will be applicable as per the bank account.

faqs.question: Why is my trading balance not updated even after adding funds successfully?
faqs.answer:
If your trading balance is not updated after a successful fund addition, it could be due to the following reasons:

• High Volume of Requests: When there is a high volume of fund addition requests, it might take some time to update your balance. Please wait for 15 minutes.

• Bank Account Issues: Ensure you add funds from the bank account registered with Angel One, and the account should be in your name. If funds are added from an unregistered bank account, the amount might get deducted but will be credited back in 3-4 working days.

• Incorrect UPI ID: The UPI ID used for fund addition might not be mapped to the bank account registered with Angel One.

Ensure you add funds from your bank account registered with Angel One.

• Unregistered UPI ID: आपकी UPI आईडी एक ऐसे बैंक खाते से मैप की गई है जो एंजेल वन के साथ पंजीकृत नहीं है.

• Transfer Limit Exceeded: आपके बैंक द्वारा निर्धारित आपकी UPI स्थानांतरण सीमा समाप्त हो गई है.

• Wrong UPI PIN: You have entered the wrong UPI PIN.

• Incorrect Method: You are transferring funds to Angel One’s UPI ID directly instead of using the ‘धन जोड़ें’ option on the Angel One app/platform.

Ensure you follow the correct procedure and check the above points to resolve the issue.

faqs.answer:
You might be unable to add funds via net banking due to the following reasons:

• Unregistered Bank Account: You are making payments from a bank account that is not registered with Angel One.

• Mismatched Bank Details: You have added different bank account details on the ‘धन जोड़ें’ page and net banking page.

• Incorrect Credentials: You have entered incorrect credentials on the bank’s net banking page.

• Insufficient Balance: लेन-देन करने के लिए आपके बैंक खाते में पर्याप्त शेष राशि नहीं है.

• Add funds using net banking.

Please make sure to add funds from your bank account registered with Angel One in all the above options.

• Follow the subsequent steps to authorize your transaction, and the funds will be added to your account.

faqs.answer: Yes, as per regulatory guidelines and compliance norms, it is mandatory to transfer funds through the bank accounts registered with Angel One.

faqs.answer:
If the amount is debited from the bank but not added to your Angel One balance, it could be due to the following reasons:

• Unregistered Bank Account: You might have tried to add funds from an unregistered bank account. The debited amount will be credited back to your bank in 3-4 working days.

• Technical Glitch: There could be a technical glitch at your bank’s end. The debited amount will be refunded in 3-4 working days.

faqs.question: Can I use debit/credit card to add funds to my Angel One account?
faqs.answer: आप अपने डेबिट या क्रेडिट कार्ड का उपयोग करके अपने एंजेल वन खाते में धनराशि नहीं जोड़ सकते। नियामक दिशानिर्देशों के अनुसार, आपका लेनदेन सत्यापित बैंक खाते से होना चाहिए। साथ ही, शेयर बाज़ारों में क्रेडिट कार्ड के उपयोग की अनुमति नहीं है।

faqs.question: क्या मेरे एंजेल वन खाते में धनराशि जोड़ने की कोई सीमा है?
faqs.answer:
• The limit for fund addition via UPI is 1 lakh per day.

• For net banking, the limit will be applicable as per the bank account.

faqs.question: Why were my funds withdrawn and credited to my bank account even though I didn’t place a request?
faqs.answer:
There are two reasons why this could happen.

• Quarterly Settlement: As per the SEBI guidelines, all stockbrokers are required to transfer the funds lying in the client account back to their bank at least once every quarter. The funds will be transferred back to the primary bank account mapped to your Angel One account.

• Fund Settlement Frequency: Your fund settlement frequency might be set to daily settlement. You can edit it by visiting Account → Profile → Fund Settlement Frequency in our mobile app.

faqs.question: What is quarterly settlement of funds or SEBI payout?
faqs.answer: The quarterly settlement of funds is a SEBI requirement for all stockbrokers to settle client funds lying in trading accounts at least once every quarter. धनराशि आपके एंजेल वन खाते से मैप किए गए प्राथमिक बैंक खाते में वापस स्थानांतरित कर दी जाती है।

faqs.question: When will I get money in my bank account after placing a fund withdrawal request?
faqs.answer:
We process your fund withdrawal request as per the below timeline:

दिन
भुगतान अनुरोध समय
द्वारा जमा की गई धनराशि (लगभग)

सोमवार से शुक्रवार
12:00 पूर्वाह्न - 07:00 पूर्वाह्न
सुबह 11:30 बजे, उसी दिन

प्रातः 07:00 बजे - सायं 05:30 बजे तक
रात्रि 11:30 बजे, उसी दिन

05:30 अपराह्न - 12:00 पूर्वाह्न
प्रातः 11:30, अगला कार्य दिवस

Saturday, Sunday
Anytime
प्रातः 11:30, अगला कार्य दिवस

Trading/Settlement Holiday
Anytime
प्रातः 11:30, अगला कार्य दिवस

To learn more about the fund withdrawal cycle, click here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/intraday-trading/funds-payout-explained).

faqs.question: When can I withdraw funds after selling my shares?
faqs.answer:
You can withdraw money from your sell transaction on T+1 day, except for Saturday, Sunday, and Trading/Settlement holidays.

उदाहरण के लिए, if you sold your shares on 14th August, the amount from the transaction will be available for withdrawal on 16th August, since 15th August is a trading holiday.

Click here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/intraday-trading/funds-payout-explained) for more information.

faqs.question: Why is my withdrawal amount not credited to my bank on time?
faqs.answer:
The delay in crediting your withdrawal amount can be due to the following reasons:

• Bank Delay: Angel One has approved your request, but there’s a delay at the bank’s end. Please wait for 4 hours or directly contact your bank in this case.

• New Trades: If you entered into new trades after placing the withdrawal request, it can delay the settlement and processing. Please wait for 24 hours for processing and approval.

• Non-Trading दिन: Withdrawal requests are processed only on trading/working days. उदाहरण के लिए, if you placed a request at 6 pm on Thursday, and Friday and the next Monday are holidays, your funds will be credited by 11:30 am on Tuesday. Consider weekends and trading/settlement holidays when planning your withdrawal.

• High Volume of Requests: In rare cases, a high number of requests can delay processing from Angel One. Please wait for 6 hours from the cut-off time and reach out for support.

faqs.question: मेरा निकासी योग्य शेष उपलब्ध ट्रेडिंग शेष से भिन्न क्यों है?
faqs.answer:
The difference between your withdrawable and trading balance could be due to the following reasons.

• When you enter a trade, your trading balance changes in real-time but the withdrawable balance is updated at the end of the day.

• Funds from sell transactions can be withdrawn on T+1 day (the next working day).

• You cannot withdraw funds on the same day you added them; you can withdraw them on the next working day.

Click here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/intraday-trading/funds-payout-explained) इस पर अधिक विस्तृत जानकारी प्राप्त करने के लिए।

faqs.question: Why is my money not credited to my bank account even though the withdrawal request is approved?
faqs.answer:
If your withdrawal request is approved, it indicates that Angel One has instructed your bank to credit the amount.

Please wait till the expected time mentioned on the app. If the time has passed, please wait for 5-6 hours. You can also check your bank statement and contact your bank.

faqs.question: Why is my withdrawal amount not credited instantly?
faqs.answer: Withdrawal requests are not credited instantly because they are processed in batches to account for any trades you might have entered on that day. These requests are processed after trading hours, considering your buy/sell transactions.

faqs.question: Why is my withdrawal request partially approved?
faqs.answer:
Your withdrawal request might be partially approved due to the following reasons:

• New Trades: You entered into new trades after placing the request. Example: If you had Rs. 1000 and placed a withdrawal request at 11 am for Rs. 1000, but then bought shares worth Rs. 500 at 2 pm, you will receive Rs. 500 (minus brokerage and charges).

• Margin Requirements: आपके खाते में मार्जिन आवश्यकताएँ हैं.

• Accrual Charges: You have pending accrual charges on your account.

Click here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/intraday-trading/funds-payout-explained) for more information.

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my fund withdrawal request?
faqs.answer:
You can follow these steps to check the status of your withdrawal request:

• Click on the Account screen in the app.

• Scroll down to the Dash section.

• Click on Fund Transactions.

• Click on Funds Withdrawn.

Click here (https://angel-one.onelink.me/JAAb/transactiondetails) to find all the fund withdrawal requests and their statuses.

faqs.question: Why am I unable to withdraw my money from my Angel One account?
faqs.answer:
You might be unable to withdraw your money for the following reasons:

• Sell Transactions: Funds from sell transactions can be withdrawn on T+1 day (the next working day). उदाहरण के लिए, if you sold shares worth Rs. 1000 on Friday, you can place a withdrawal request on Monday.

• Same-Day Deposits: Funds added to your account cannot be withdrawn on the same day; you can withdraw them on the next working day.

faqs.question: How can I withdraw funds from my Angel One account?
faqs.answer:
You can withdraw your funds from the Angel One account by following the below steps.

• Log in to your account.

• Go to the Account screen.

• Click on the “Withdraw”  button under Trading Balance at the top of the screen.

• Here you will be able to check the withdrawable amount.

• You can enter the amount you want to withdraw and the bank account to which the money needs to be credited.

• Please note the estimated credit time shown on the screen.

Kindly note that the withdrawal amount is updated every morning after taking the previous day’s transactions into account.

faqs.question: Why is my withdrawable balance less than the trading balance?
faqs.answer:
Your withdrawable balance is the amount eligible for withdrawal on a given day. Any unsettled balance from your trades will be available for withdrawal on T+1 day (next working day).

The following balances will be available for withdrawal on the next working day:

• Funds from delivery sell transactions.

• Profits from intraday transactions.

• Profits from F&O transactions.

• Funds from commodity and currency transactions.

faqs.question: Why is my withdrawable balance not updated?
faqs.answer: Your withdrawable balance is updated once every morning, after adjusting for all the transactions made on the previous trading day. This balance can be different from the trading balance, which changes in real time.

faqs.question: सिफ़ारिशें क्या हैं?
faqs.answer:
सिफ़ारिशें जोखिम को कम करने और लाभ को अधिकतम करने में मदद करने के लिए एंजेल वन द्वारा सुझाए गए स्टॉक हैं।

आप विजिट करके सिफ़ारिशें देख सकते हैं https://www.angelone.in/trade/home (https://www.angelone.in/trade/home)

आपको इस स्क्रीन पर "सलाहकार के माध्यम से शीर्ष स्टॉक चयन" अनुभाग के तहत सिफारिशें मिलेंगी।

faqs.question: सिफ़ारिशों के लिए शुल्क क्या हैं?
faqs.answer: हम अनुशंसाओं के लिए कोई शुल्क नहीं लेते हैं. जब कोई उपयोगकर्ता कोई व्यापार करेगा तो सामान्य व्यापार शुल्क लगाया जाएगा।

faqs.question: मुझे कुछ बेहतरीन बढ़ते स्टॉक सुझाएं?
faqs.answer:
एंजेल वन आपको सलाहकार सेवाओं के माध्यम से सिफारिशें प्रदान करता है। व्यापक शोध के आधार पर, हम पोर्टफोलियो और एकल स्टॉक सलाह प्रदान करते हैं।

अधिक जानने के लिए आप एंजेल की होम स्क्रीन पर सिंगल स्टॉक एडवाइजरी देख सकते हैं

एक वेब या मोबाइल प्लेटफ़ॉर्म. यहां आपको इंट्राडे, शॉर्ट और लॉन्ग टर्म स्टॉक के लिए सुझाव मिलेंगे।

यदि आप शेयरों का एक समूह खरीदना चाहते हैं तो आप होम स्क्रीन पर पोर्टफोलियो सलाह भी देख सकते हैं।

faqs.question: मुझे अल्पावधि या इंट्राडे के लिए कुछ स्टॉक सुझाएं?
faqs.answer:
एंजेल वन आपको सलाहकार सेवाओं के माध्यम से सिफारिशें प्रदान करता है। व्यापक शोध के आधार पर, हम पोर्टफोलियो और एकल स्टॉक सलाह प्रदान करते हैं।

अधिक जानने के लिए आप एंजेल की होम स्क्रीन पर सिंगल स्टॉक एडवाइजरी देख सकते हैं

यदि आप शेयरों का एक समूह खरीदना चाहते हैं तो आप पोर्टफोलियो सलाह का पता लगा सकते हैं।
