faqs.question: मैं बीएसई सेंसेक्स पर खरीदने या बेचने में असमर्थ हूं।
faqs.answer:
आपको निम्न कारणों से इस समस्या का सामना करना पड़ सकता है।

हो सकता है कि आपने डेरिवेटिव या F&O सेगमेंट को सक्रिय न किया हो। डेरिवेटिव सेगमेंट को सक्रिय करने के लिए, एंजेल वन प्लेटफॉर्म पर अकाउंट → प्रोफाइल → सेगमेंट सब्सक्रिप्शन सेक्शन पर जाएं।

यदि आपने F&O सेगमेंट सक्रिय किया है,

सेंसेक्स फ्यूचर्स और ऑप्शंस में ट्रेडिंग की अनुमति है। हालाँकि, कुछ ऐसे अनुबंध हैं जो तरलता की कमी के कारण व्यापार के लिए अक्षम कर दिए जाएंगे। अनुबंध के लिए ओपन इंटरेस्ट और वॉल्यूम के आधार पर अनुबंधों को ट्रेडिंग के लिए ब्लॉक/अनब्लॉक किया जाता है।

परिणामस्वरूप, बीएसई एफएंडओ सेगमेंट में इंट्राडे ऑर्डर फिलहाल प्रतिबंधित हैं। इसके अलावा, आप वर्तमान में बीएसई एफएंडओ पर केवल सीमित ऑर्डर दे सकते हैं क्योंकि बाजार ऑर्डर के लिए बोली-पूछने का प्रसार व्यापक हो सकता है।

इसके अलावा तरलता की कमी के कारण हमने व्यापार को प्रतिबंधित कर दिया है बैंकेक्स और सेंसेक्स50.

faqs.question: मुझे एक्सचेंज नॉट इनेबल्ड एरर मिल रहा है। संभावित कारण क्या हो सकते हैं?
faqs.answer:
यह त्रुटि तब होती है जब उपयोगकर्ता के लिए कोई विशेष खंड सक्रिय नहीं होता है। यदि आपने किसी सेगमेंट को सक्रिय करने के लिए आवेदन किया है लेकिन फिर भी यह त्रुटि आ रही है, तो यह आम तौर पर दो स्थितियों के कारण होता है।

• एनएफओ में यदि आय प्रमाण प्रस्तुत नहीं किया गया है।

• एमसीएक्स में यदि इलेक्ट्रॉनिक कॉन्ट्रैक्ट नोट (ईसीएन) जमा नहीं किया गया है।

एफ एंड ओ या कमोडिटी सेगमेंट को सक्रिय करने के तरीके के बारे में अधिक जानने के लिए, अपने वेब या मोबाइल प्लेटफॉर्म में अकाउंट → प्रोफाइल → सेगमेंट सब्सक्रिप्शन पर जाएं। आप देख सकेंगे कि कौन से सभी खंड सक्रिय हैं और सक्रियण अनुरोध ऑनलाइन सबमिट कर सकेंगे।

faqs.question: मुझे पैन कार्ड अवैध क्यों मिल रहा है?
faqs.answer:
इसका कारण पैन और आधार का लिंक न होना हो सकता है। यदि आपने पहले ही दोनों को लिंक कर दिया है, तो कृपया इस लेख की जाँच करें (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/online-share-trading/impact-on-trades-investments-if-pan-aadhaar-not-linked).

सीडीएसएल को आपके पैन आधार लिंकिंग स्टेटस पर एंजेल वन को अपडेट करने में 10 दिन तक का समय लग सकता है। सिस्टम में अपडेट प्रभावी होने के लिए कृपया कुछ और दिनों तक प्रतीक्षा करें।

faqs.question: मुझे "पैन कार्ड आधार से लिंक नहीं है" समस्या मिल रही है। लेकिन मैंने पहले ही दोनों को लिंक कर दिया है
faqs.answer:
यदि आपने पहले ही दोनों को लिंक कर दिया है, तो कृपया इस लेख की जाँच करें (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/online-share-trading/impact-on-trades-investments-if-pan-aadhaar-not-linked).

सीडीएसएल को आपके पैन आधार लिंकिंग स्टेटस पर एंजेल वन को अपडेट करने में 10 दिन तक का समय लग सकता है। सिस्टम में अपडेट प्रभावी होने के लिए कृपया कुछ और दिनों तक प्रतीक्षा करें।

faqs.question: पैन कार्ड अमान्य होने के कारण मेरा ऑर्डर अस्वीकृत हो रहा है?
faqs.answer:
इसका कारण पैन और आधार का लिंक न होना हो सकता है।

यदि आपने पहले ही दोनों को लिंक कर दिया है, तो कृपया इस लेख की जाँच करें (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/online-share-trading/impact-on-trades-investments-if-pan-aadhaar-not-linked).

सीडीएसएल को आपके पैन आधार लिंकिंग स्टेटस पर एंजेल वन को अपडेट करने में 10 दिन तक का समय लग सकता है। सिस्टम में अपडेट प्रभावी होने के लिए कृपया कुछ और दिनों तक प्रतीक्षा करें।

faqs.question: मैं अपने ऑर्डर की स्थिति कैसे जांच सकता हूं?
faqs.answer:
अपनी स्क्रीन के नीचे ऑर्डर पर टैप करें

अपने सभी लंबित ऑर्डर देखने के लिए ओपन ऑर्डर पर क्लिक करें

आप स्थिति पर क्लिक करके अपने निष्पादित ऑर्डर देख सकेंगे

आप खुले ऑर्डर के अंतर्गत ऑर्डर इतिहास बटन पर क्लिक करके ऑर्डर की पूरी सूची भी देख सकते हैं

faqs.question: मुझे कैसे पता चलेगा कि मेरा ऑर्डर पूरा हो गया है?
faqs.answer:
अपनी स्क्रीन के नीचे ऑर्डर पर टैप करें

आप स्थिति विकल्पों पर क्लिक करके अपने निष्पादित/पूर्ण ऑर्डर देख पाएंगे

आप ओपन ऑर्डर टैब के अंतर्गत ऑर्डर इतिहास बटन पर क्लिक करके अपने पिछले ऑर्डर भी देख सकते हैं

faqs.question: मैं आज की स्थिति कहां देख सकता हूं?
faqs.answer:
अपनी स्क्रीन के नीचे ऑर्डर पर टैप करें

आप स्थिति टैब पर क्लिक करके अपनी वर्तमान मौजूदा स्थिति देख पाएंगे

आप "बंद स्थिति देखें" टैब पर क्लिक करके भी अपनी बंद स्थिति देख सकते हैं

faqs.question: मेरा ऑर्डर लंबित क्यों है?
faqs.answer: बाजार मूल्य में बदलाव, ऑर्डर मूल्य तक नहीं पहुंचने या खरीदारों/विक्रेताओं की कम संख्या जैसे कारणों से ऑर्डर लंबित हो सकते हैं।

faqs.question: क्या मैं बाजार बंद होने पर ऑर्डर दे सकता हूं (एएमओ ऑर्डर)?
faqs.answer: आप बाजार बंद होने के बाद अगले कारोबारी दिन के लिए एएमओ ऑर्डर दे सकते हैं। एएमओ ऑर्डर सामान्य रूप से नियमित खरीद/बिक्री ऑर्डर की तरह रखे जा सकते हैं जिन्हें बाजार खुलने के बाद एक्सचेंज में भेज दिया जाता है।

faqs.question: प्रकट मात्रा क्या है?
faqs.answer:
प्रकट मात्रा सुविधा आपको बाज़ार में वास्तविक ऑर्डर का केवल एक हिस्सा घोषित करने की अनुमति देती है जिसे आप खरीदना/बेचना चाहते हैं।

एक बार जब आप प्रकट मात्रा निर्दिष्ट कर देते हैं, तो ऑर्डर एक्सचेंज को भेज दिया जाता है और केवल प्रकट भाग ही बाजार स्क्रीन पर दिखाया जाता है।

प्रकट की गई मात्रा न तो ऑर्डर मात्रा के बराबर या उससे अधिक होनी चाहिए और न ही ऑर्डर मात्रा के 10% से कम होनी चाहिए।

faqs.question: मैं अपनी F&O पोजीशन कैसे बदल सकता हूँ?
faqs.answer:
अपनी स्क्रीन के नीचे ऑर्डर पर टैप करें

उस ऑर्डर पर क्लिक करें जिसे आप कनवर्ट करना चाहते हैं

कनवर्ट पर टैप करें

उत्पाद प्रकार चुनें और सबमिट पर क्लिक करें।

आपकी स्थिति सफलतापूर्वक परिवर्तित कर दी जाएगी.

faqs.question: मैं अपना ऑर्डर कैसे संशोधित कर सकता हूं?
faqs.answer:
अपनी स्क्रीन के नीचे ऑर्डर पर टैप करें

ओपन ऑर्डर पर क्लिक करें

उस ऑर्डर पर टैप करें जिसे आप संशोधित करना चाहते हैं और एडिट ऑर्डर पर क्लिक करें

आप यहां से अपने ऑर्डर को संशोधित कर सकेंगे

faqs.question: मैं स्टॉक कैसे खरीद/बेच सकता हूँ?
faqs.answer:
उस शेयर पर टैप करें जिसके लिए आप खरीद/बिक्री ऑर्डर देना चाहते हैं

खरीदें/बेचें पर क्लिक करें और

डिलीवरी, मार्जिन और इंट्राडे के बीच मोड का चयन करें

मात्रा, कीमत दर्ज करें और प्लेस बाय/सेल ऑर्डर पर क्लिक करें

faqs.question: मैं अपनी इंट्राडे स्थिति को डिलीवरी में कैसे परिवर्तित कर सकता हूं?
faqs.answer:
फिलहाल एंजेल स्पार्क में स्थिति रूपांतरण उपलब्ध नहीं है। इसके शुरू होते ही इसमें अक्सर पूछे जाने वाले प्रश्न जोड़ दिए जाएंगे

पीएम की टिप्पणी- इसकी इजाजत है. कृपया बिंदु संख्या 6 की जांच करें। रूपांतरण के बारे में एक बिंदु बनाएं क्योंकि यात्रा समान है

faqs.question: मैं अपनी मौजूदा स्थिति के लिए स्टॉप लॉस ऑर्डर कैसे दे सकता हूं?
faqs.answer:
अपनी स्क्रीन के नीचे ऑर्डर पर टैप करें

पदों पर क्लिक करें

उस ऑर्डर पर टैप करें जिसके लिए आप स्टॉप लॉस लगाना चाहते हैं

स्क्रीन के नीचे स्टॉप लॉस बटन पर टैप करें

ट्रिगर मूल्य, कीमत दर्ज करें और खरीदें/बेचें ऑर्डर पर क्लिक करें

faqs.question: रोबो ऑर्डर क्या है?
faqs.answer:
रोबो ऑर्डर एक मल्टी-लेग ऑर्डर है जिसका उपयोग इंट्राडे ट्रेडिंग में किया जाता है जो आपको शुरुआती ऑर्डर के साथ 2 और ऑर्डर देने की अनुमति देता है। एक ऑर्डर ऑर्डर कीमत से कम कीमत पर दिया जाता है और दूसरा ऑर्डर कीमत से अधिक कीमत पर रखा जाता है।

जब कोई भी निर्धारित लक्ष्य पूरा हो जाता है तो ऑर्डर स्वचालित रूप से समाप्त हो जाता है।

इन ऑर्डरों को लक्ष्य तक पहुँचने से पहले या स्टॉप लॉस लक्ष्य से पहले मैन्युअल रूप से बाहर निकाला जा सकता है।

faqs.question: क्या मैं एनएसई और बीएसई पर रोबो ऑर्डर दे सकता हूं?
faqs.answer: हां, रोबो ऑर्डर एनएसई और बीएसई दोनों में दिए जा सकते हैं

faqs.question: कौन सा उत्पाद प्रकार रोबो ऑर्डर देने की अनुमति देता है?
faqs.answer: आप रोबो ऑर्डर केवल इंट्राडे में दे सकते हैं।

faqs.question: क्या मैं रोबो ऑर्डर के लिए एमटीएफ सुविधा का लाभ उठा सकता हूँ?
faqs.answer: नहीं, रोबो ऑर्डर के लिए एमटीएफ सुविधा उपलब्ध नहीं है।

faqs.question: क्या मैं वस्तुओं और मुद्राओं में रोबो ऑर्डर दे सकता हूँ?
faqs.answer: रोबो ऑर्डर केवल स्टॉक और सूचकांकों के लिए नकदी बाजार खंड (इक्विटी और डेरिवेटिव) में दिए जा सकते हैं।

faqs.question: क्या मैं रोबो ऑर्डर का उपयोग करके डिलीवरी ऑर्डर दे सकता हूँ?
faqs.answer: नहीं, आप डिलीवरी ट्रेडिंग में रोबो ऑर्डर नहीं दे सकते।

faqs.question: क्या मैं सभी स्टॉक में रोबो ऑर्डर दे सकता हूँ?
faqs.answer: इंट्राडे ट्रेडिंग के लिए रोबो ऑर्डर कैश सेगमेंट के चयनित शेयरों में दिए जा सकते हैं। रोबो ऑर्डर कम वॉल्यूम वाले शेयरों पर नहीं दिए जा सकते।

faqs.question: क्या मैं दिन में किसी भी समय रोबो ऑर्डर दे सकता हूँ?
faqs.answer: आप ट्रेडिंग दिवस पर सुबह 9:15 बजे से दोपहर 3:10 बजे के बीच रोबो ऑर्डर दे सकते हैं।

faqs.question: यदि मेरा रोबो ऑर्डर दिन के दौरान निष्पादित नहीं होता है तो क्या होगा?
faqs.answer:
यदि आपका प्रथम चरण का ऑर्डर (प्रारंभिक सीमा ऑर्डर) ट्रेडिंग दिवस के बाजार समय के दौरान निष्पादित नहीं होता है, तो रोबो ऑर्डर रद्द कर दिया जाएगा।

यदि आपका पहले चरण का ऑर्डर निष्पादित हो जाता है और न तो दूसरे चरण का और न ही तीसरे चरण का ऑर्डर निष्पादित होता है तो आपकी स्थिति दोपहर 3:10 बजे स्वतः चुकता हो जाएगी।

faqs.question: रोबो ऑर्डर को कितनी बार संशोधित किया जा सकता है?
faqs.answer:
रोबो ऑर्डर को निम्नलिखित तरीकों से कितनी भी बार संशोधित किया जा सकता है:

यदि आदेश निष्पादित नहीं किया गया है तो प्रारंभिक आदेश को संशोधित किया जा सकता है।

प्रारंभिक ऑर्डर निष्पादित होने की स्थिति में, केवल स्टॉप लॉस और टारगेट ऑर्डर को संशोधित किया जा सकता है।

एक बार स्टॉप लॉस/लक्ष्य मूल्य निष्पादित हो जाने के बाद कोई संशोधन संभव नहीं है।

faqs.question: रोबो ऑर्डर कैसे दें?
faqs.answer:
अपनी स्क्रीन के नीचे वॉचलिस्ट पर टैप करें

खरीदें/बेचें पर क्लिक करें और इंट्राडे चुनें

स्मार्ट ऑर्डर पर टैप करें और रोबो ऑर्डर चुनें

मात्रा, कीमत, स्टॉप लॉस और लक्ष्य लक्ष्य दर्ज करें

प्लेस बाय/सेल ऑर्डर पर क्लिक करें

आपका ऑर्डर फंड उपलब्धता के अधीन सफलतापूर्वक रखा जाएगा

faqs.question: डेस्कटॉप या वेब पर रोबो ऑर्डर कैसे दें?
faqs.answer: वर्तमान में, हमारे पास केवल मोबाइल ऐप पर रोबो ऑर्डर सुविधा है। हम इसे वेब पर भी लाने पर काम कर रहे हैं।

faqs.question: इंट्राडे स्क्वायर-ऑफ का समय क्या है?
faqs.answer:
इंट्राडे स्क्वायर-ऑफ़ के लिए समय नीचे दिया गया है:

इक्विटी सेगमेंट: दोपहर 3:15 बजे

वायदा विकल्प खंड: अपराह्न 3:20 बजे

मुद्रा खंड: शाम 4:45 बजे

कमोडिटी सेगमेंट: 11:15/11:45 अपराह्न (डेलाइट सेविंग टाइम के आधार पर)

faqs.question: मेरी स्थिति क्यों ख़त्म कर दी गई?
faqs.answer:
Your position could have been squared off due to any of the below reasons:

• Intraday trades will auto squared off at 3:15 pm for the Cash segment and at 3:20 for the F&O segment.

• Intraday trades will be squared off if you lose 80% of your Available Margin.

• When you don’t maintain the minimum required margin in your account your shares will be squared off 4 days after the shortfall occurs.

• When your shares bought using Margin are down by more than 50% of your fund balance, square-off will be done on the next trading day.

• Shares bought under Margin Product need to be fully paid or pledged, failing which the shared will be squared off after 7 days.

• यदि आपका खाता डेबिट/नेगेटिव बैलेंस के अंतर्गत चला जाता है, तो आपके शेयर 7 दिनों के बाद चुकता कर दिए जाएंगे।

faqs.question: मेरी इंट्राडे पोजीशन को चुकता क्यों नहीं किया गया?
faqs.answer:
उस स्टॉक में ऊपरी/निचले सर्किट के कारण आपकी खरीद/बिक्री की स्थिति समाप्त नहीं हो सकती है।

यदि आपने स्टॉक खरीदा है और शेयर लोअर सर्किट में है तो आपके शेयर अगले दिन बेचे जाएंगे।

यदि आपने शेयर कम बेचा है तो शेयर पर अपर सर्किट है तो शेयर नीलाम कर दिए जाएंगे।

faqs.question: जब मैं अपनी स्थिति से बाहर निकलने या स्टॉप-लॉस ऑर्डर देने की कोशिश कर रहा हूं, तो इसे अस्वीकार क्यों किया जा रहा है?
faqs.answer: ऐसा तब हो सकता है जब आपके पास स्टॉप-लॉस (एसएल) या एक्जिट ऑर्डर पहले से ही लंबित हो। पहले से ही लंबित स्टॉप-लॉस या एग्जिट ऑर्डर के साथ, आपको डुप्लिकेट एसएल/एग्जिट ऑर्डर देने में सक्षम होने के लिए अतिरिक्त धन की आवश्यकता होगी। यदि आपके खाते में यह अतिरिक्त धनराशि नहीं है, तो आपका डुप्लिकेट निकास आदेश अस्वीकार कर दिया जाएगा। इसीलिए हम बाहर निकलते समय आपको सूचित करते हैं कि क्या किसी स्थिति के विरुद्ध कोई एसएल/निकास आदेश लंबित है, ताकि किसी भी डुप्लिकेट ऑर्डर और अस्वीकृति से बचा जा सके।

faqs.question: मेरा स्टॉप-लॉस (एसएल) ऑर्डर चालू हो गया था लेकिन यह निष्पादित नहीं हुआ। ऐसा क्यों हुआ?
faqs.answer:
इसके पीछे 2 प्रमुख कारण हो सकते हैं:

बाजार की गहराई में कमी के कारण परिसंपत्ति को परिभाषित स्टॉप-लॉस सीमा मूल्य पर खरीदार/विक्रेता की कमी हो सकती है। ऑर्डर ख़रीदे या बेचे जाते समय कतारबद्ध होते हैं।

एक। उदाहरण के लिए: मान लीजिए कि 50 खरीदार और 100 विक्रेता हैं जो ₹90 पर एक शेयर पर व्यापार करने की प्रतीक्षा कर रहे हैं। ₹90 तक पहुंचने पर, पहले 50 विक्रेताओं के ऑर्डर निष्पादित किए जाएंगे, और शेष 50 विक्रेताओं को नए खरीदारों के लिए इंतजार करना होगा। यदि आप उन शेष 50 विक्रेताओं में से एक हैं, तो आपका बेचने का आदेश यदि कोई संबंधित खरीदार नहीं है तो यह लंबित रहेगा और इसके विपरीत भी।
• उच्च अस्थिरता के दौरान कीमत में उतार-चढ़ाव कुछ मानदंडों को पूरा नहीं करता है, उदाहरण के लिए मान लीजिए कि आपने एक रखा है स्टॉप-लॉस बेचें ट्रिगर मूल्य के साथ ₹100 और कीमत ₹100 पर सीमित करें। अब कल्पना करें कि एलटीपी ₹100 को छू गया (यहां, एसएल ट्रिगर हो जाएगा) और उच्च अस्थिरता के कारण जल्दी ही ₹100 से नीचे चला गया। ₹100 की सीमा कीमत का मतलब है कि स्टॉप-लॉस ऑर्डर केवल ₹100 या अधिक पर निष्पादित होगा। अब यह ऑर्डर लंबित रहेगा क्योंकि कीमत 100 रुपये से कम है और निष्पादन तभी होगा जब कीमत 100 रुपये तक पहुंच जाएगी या पार कर जाएगी। इसलिए आपका स्टॉप-लॉस ऑर्डर निष्पादित नहीं किया गया था। इस कारण से, हम उच्च अस्थिरता के दौरान स्टॉप लॉस निष्पादन की संभावना बढ़ाने के लिए ट्रिगर मूल्य और सीमा मूल्य के बीच पर्याप्त अंतर रखने की सलाह देते हैं।

टिप्पणी: निष्पादन की संभावना बढ़ाने के लिए, हम सीमा मूल्य के डिफ़ॉल्ट मान को ट्रिगर मूल्य से 2 टिक दूर रखते हैं। ऐसा इसलिए किया जाता है ताकि यदि एलटीपी ऑर्डर को ट्रिगर करने के बाद तेजी से आगे बढ़ता है, तो सीमा मूल्य बाधा नहीं होनी चाहिए और ऑर्डर अभी भी निष्पादित होना चाहिए। इसके अलावा, यदि आप पूर्व-निर्धारित सीमा मूल्य को बदलते हैं और इसे ट्रिगर मूल्य के करीब लाते हैं, तो अस्थिरता के मामलों में निष्पादन की संभावना कम हो सकती है।

faqs.question: मेरा स्टॉप-लॉस ऑर्डर ट्रिगर हो गया, भले ही पूर्वनिर्धारित ट्रिगर मूल्य सामने नहीं आया था। क्यों?
faqs.answer: संभावना यह है कि बाज़ार मूल्य ने स्टॉप-लॉस मूल्य को प्रभावित किया हो, भले ही क्षण भर के लिए और उस समय आप इसे पहचान न सकें। एक सेकंड के भीतर, कीमतें कई बार बदल सकती हैं और उन सभी को एक्सचेंज द्वारा ब्रोकरों को रिले नहीं किया जाता है, खासकर उच्च अस्थिरता के दौरान। परिणामस्वरूप, कीमतों में इस तरह का क्षणिक उतार-चढ़ाव कहीं देखने को नहीं मिलता है। मूल्य मिलान और ऑर्डर का निष्पादन एक्सचेंजों द्वारा किया जाता है, ब्रोकर द्वारा नहीं।

faqs.question: स्टॉप लॉस क्या है?
faqs.answer:
स्टॉप-लॉस एक उपकरण है जिसका उपयोग निवेशक किसी व्यापार में नुकसान को कम करने के लिए करते हैं। कुछ व्यापारी इसे अग्रिम आदेश के रूप में परिभाषित करते हैं, जो स्टॉक मूल्य ट्रिगर मूल्य स्तर तक पहुंचने पर खुली स्थिति को स्वचालित रूप से बंद कर देता है।

स्टॉप लॉस नुकसान को कम करने में मदद करता है लेकिन व्यापार से मुनाफे को भी सीमित करता है।

faqs.question: ट्रेलिंग स्टॉप लॉस क्या है?
faqs.answer: ट्रेलिंग स्टॉप-लॉस एक ऐसा ऑर्डर है जो आपको किसी व्यापार में होने वाले नुकसान का अधिकतम मूल्य या प्रतिशत निर्धारित करने देता है। यदि प्रतिभूति मूल्य आपके पक्ष में बढ़ता या गिरता है, तो ट्रिगर मूल्य निर्धारित मूल्य या प्रतिशत पर इसके साथ बढ़ जाता है। यदि सुरक्षा मूल्य आपके विरुद्ध बढ़ता या घटता है, तो ऑर्डर की प्रकृति के आधार पर ट्रिगर मूल्य यथावत रहता है।

faqs.question: स्टॉप-लॉस कैसे ट्रिगर होता है?
faqs.answer: बाजार की अस्थिर स्थिति के दौरान स्टॉप-लॉस आपका वास्तविक रक्षक हो सकता है। व्यापार की शुरुआत में निर्धारित मूल्य स्तर व्यापारियों को स्टॉप-लॉस तक पहुंचने पर स्वचालित रूप से अपनी स्थिति बंद करने की अनुमति देता है। ट्रिगर मूल्य स्तर पर उपलब्ध अगले मूल्य पर स्क्वेरिंग ऑफ होता है और नुकसान को सीमित करने में मदद मिलती है।

faqs.question: ट्रेडिंग का 1% नियम क्या है?
faqs.answer: 1% नियम किसी व्यापार या जोखिम-प्रति-व्यापार में उठाए जा सकने वाले जोखिम की अधिकतम सीमा को परिभाषित करता है। इसका तात्पर्य आपकी स्थिति को समायोजित करना है ताकि स्टॉप-लॉस ट्रिगर होने पर कुल हानि आपके व्यापार मूल्य के 1% से अधिक न हो। 1% नियम महत्वपूर्ण नुकसान से बचने में मदद करता है।

faqs.question: क्या मैं एंजेलवन ट्रेडिंग ऐप के साथ ट्रेडिंग में स्टॉप-लॉस का उपयोग कर सकता हूं?
faqs.answer:
आप नीचे दिए गए सरल चरणों का पालन करके एंजेलवन मोबाइल ऐप में स्टॉप लॉस ऑर्डर दे सकते हैं:

• एंजेलवन ऐप पर जाएं और खरीदने/बेचने के लिए स्टॉक का चयन करें

• व्यापार की मात्रा चुनें

• 'ट्रिगर मूल्य' सेट करें

• वह मूल्य दर्ज करें जहां आप स्टॉप-लॉस लगाना चाहते हैं

• स्टॉप-लॉस मूल्य की पुष्टि करें, "खरीदें/बेचें" पर क्लिक करें और ऑर्डर की पुष्टि करें

faqs.question: लिमिट और मार्केट ऑर्डर के बीच क्या अंतर है?
faqs.answer:
एक सीमा आदेश में खरीद मूल्य या बिक्री मूल्य निर्दिष्ट किया जाता है और व्यापार तभी निष्पादित किया जाता है जब कीमत पूरी हो जाती है।

इसके विपरीत, एक मार्केट ऑर्डर मौजूदा बाजार मूल्य पर निष्पादित होता है।

faqs.question: तत्काल या रद्द (आईओसी) आदेश क्या है?
faqs.answer: तत्काल या रद्द (आईओसी) ऑर्डर के मामले में, ऑर्डर को बाजार में जारी होते ही निष्पादित करना होगा। इसका मतलब है कि सुरक्षा की खरीद या बिक्री लगभग तुरंत हो जाती है, और यदि ऐसा नहीं होता है, तो ऑर्डर स्वचालित रूप से रद्द हो जाता है।

faqs.question: मैं जीटीटी ऑर्डर कैसे दूं?
faqs.answer:
उस शेयर पर टैप करें जिसके लिए आप जीटीटी ऑर्डर देना चाहते हैं

खरीदें/बेचें पर क्लिक करें और "डिलीवरी" चुनें

स्मार्ट ऑर्डर पर क्लिक करें और जीटीटी ऑर्डर पर क्लिक करें

ट्रिगर मूल्य, सीमा मूल्य दर्ज करें और "जीटीटी बनाएं" पर क्लिक करें

faqs.question: स्टॉप लॉस ऑर्डर क्या हैं?
faqs.answer:
स्टॉप-लॉस ऑर्डर एक खरीद/बिक्री ऑर्डर है जो आपके व्यापार के विरुद्ध कीमतें बढ़ने की स्थिति में आपके नुकसान को सीमित करने में आपकी सहायता कर सकता है।

अगर आप कोई स्टॉक खरीद रहे हैं तो आपको सेल स्टॉप-लॉस जोड़ना होगा।

अगर आपको कोई स्टॉक बेचना है तो आपको बाय स्टॉप-लॉस जोड़ना होगा।

faqs.question: गुड टिल ट्रिगर ऑर्डर (जीटीटी) क्या है?
faqs.answer:
जीटीटी ऑर्डर आपको पूर्व निर्धारित मूल्य पर खरीदने या बेचने का ऑर्डर देने की अनुमति देता है।

यदि जीटीटी ऑर्डर समाप्त होने से पहले स्टॉक का बाजार मूल्य आपके निर्दिष्ट मूल्य, जिसे ट्रिगर मूल्य भी कहा जाता है, तक पहुंच जाता है तो ये ऑर्डर निष्पादित किए जाते हैं।

जीटीटी ऑर्डर एक वर्ष के लिए वैध हैं। यदि एक वर्ष के भीतर कीमत नहीं मिलती है तो ऑर्डर रद्द कर दिया जाता है

faqs.question: जीटीटी ऑर्डर की वैधता क्या है?
faqs.answer: जीटीटी ऑर्डर एक ऐसी सुविधा है जो आपको 1 वर्ष के ऑर्डर की समाप्ति तिथि के साथ अपनी वांछित कीमत पर शेयर खरीदने/बेचने की अनुमति देती है।

faqs.question: क्या मैं जीटीटी का उपयोग करके इंट्राडे ऑर्डर दे सकता हूं?
faqs.answer: जीटीटी सुविधा का उपयोग इंट्राडे के लिए नहीं किया जा सकता।

faqs.question: जीटीटी ऑर्डर का उपयोग किन सेगमेंट के लिए किया जा सकता है?
faqs.answer:
जीटीटी ऑर्डर का उपयोग डिलीवरी मार्जिन उत्पाद प्रकार के तहत इक्विटी कैश सेगमेंट के लिए किया जा सकता है

एनएसई, एमसीएक्स एनसीडीईएक्स डेरिवेटिव जीटीटी ऑर्डर कैरी फॉरवर्ड उत्पाद प्रकार के तहत रखे जा सकते हैं।

faqs.question: मेरा लिमिट ऑर्डर बाज़ार मूल्य पर निष्पादित क्यों किया गया?
faqs.answer: ऐसा तब हो सकता है जब आपने मौजूदा बाजार मूल्य से कम कीमत पर बेचने की कोशिश की हो या मौजूदा कीमत से अधिक कीमत पर खरीदने की कोशिश की हो। ऐसी स्थिति में सिस्टम इसे मार्केट ऑर्डर मानता है और मौजूदा कीमत पर निष्पादित करता है।

faqs.question: मेरा स्टॉप लॉस ऑर्डर क्यों निष्पादित किया गया, भले ही कीमत ने मेरे ट्रिगर का उल्लंघन नहीं किया हो?
faqs.answer: एक सेकंड में कई दाम मिल जाते हैं. एप्लिकेशन पर सभी मूल्य परिवर्तन नहीं दिखाए गए हैं। यह संभव है कि कीमत का उल्लंघन किया गया हो लेकिन आवेदन पर नहीं दिखाया जा सका हो। ऐसा हो सकता है क्योंकि आप प्रति सेकंड केवल एक टिक देख पाते हैं, जब स्टॉप-लॉस सीमा का उल्लंघन होता है और व्यापार निष्पादित होता है तो आप कीमत नहीं देख पाएंगे।

faqs.question: प्री-ओपन सत्र में मेरा बाज़ार ऑर्डर एक सीमा ऑर्डर क्यों बन गया?
faqs.answer:
प्री-ओपन सत्र में, सभी बेजोड़ बाजार ऑर्डर को उनके मूल टाइमस्टैम्प के साथ संतुलन मूल्य पर सीमा ऑर्डर के रूप में सामान्य बाजार में ले जाया जाता है।

यदि शुरुआती कीमत की खोज नहीं की गई है, तो बाजार ऑर्डर पिछले दिन के समापन मूल्य पर ले जाया जाएगा

faqs.question: तत्काल या रद्द आदेश (आईओसी) आदेश क्या है?
faqs.answer:
तत्काल या रद्द किए गए ऑर्डर के मामले में, ऑर्डर को बाज़ार में जारी होते ही निष्पादित करना होगा।

इसका मतलब है कि सुरक्षा की खरीद या बिक्री लगभग तुरंत हो जाती है और यदि ऐसा नहीं होता है, तो ऑर्डर स्वचालित रूप से रद्द हो जाता है।

faqs.question: डिलिवरी ऑर्डर क्या है?
faqs.answer: डिलीवरी ऑर्डर का मतलब है कि आप कुछ शेयर खरीदते हैं, और उन्हें अपने डीमैट खाते में रखते हैं। आप जब तक चाहें इन्हें अपने डीमैट खाते में रख सकते हैं। डिलीवरी ऑर्डर का उपयोग दीर्घकालिक निवेश के लिए किया जाता है।

faqs.question: इंट्राडे ऑर्डर क्या है?
faqs.answer: इंट्राडे ऑर्डर का अर्थ है उसी दिन स्थिति से बाहर निकलने के इरादे से सुरक्षा खरीदना/बेचना। आप दिन के भीतर जब चाहें तब पद से बाहर निकल सकते हैं। यदि खुला छोड़ दिया जाए तो सभी इंट्राडे ऑर्डर स्वचालित रूप से चुकता हो जाते हैं।

faqs.question: एएमओ ऑर्डर क्या है?
faqs.answer:
एएमओ ऑर्डर वे ऑर्डर हैं जो बाजार बंद होने के बाद दिए जाते हैं।

उन्हें नियमित ऑर्डर के समान ही रखा जा सकता है। इन ऑर्डरों को अगले कारोबारी दिन एक्सचेंज करने के लिए भेज दिया जाता है।

faqs.question: सीमा आदेश क्या है?
faqs.answer: लिमिट ऑर्डर एक विशिष्ट मूल्य पर स्टॉक खरीदने या बेचने का ऑर्डर है। ये आदेश एक दिन के लिए वैध हैं। यदि दिन के भीतर कीमत नहीं मिलती है, तो ये ऑर्डर स्वचालित रूप से रद्द कर दिए जाते हैं।

faqs.question: मार्केट ऑर्डर क्या है?
faqs.answer: मार्केट ऑर्डर एक खरीद या बिक्री ऑर्डर है जिसे अगले मूल्य मिलान पर तुरंत निष्पादित किया जाना है। इन ऑर्डरों का उपयोग तब किया जाता है जब आप यथाशीघ्र वांछित मात्रा खरीदना/बेचना चाहते हैं।

faqs.question: कॉल एवं ट्रेड सुविधा क्या है? क्या इस सुविधा के लिए कोई शुल्क है?
faqs.answer:
कॉल और ट्रेड सुविधा आपको एंजेल वन को कॉल करके व्यापार करने की अनुमति देती है।

कॉल ट्रेड के लिए शुल्क प्रति निष्पादित ऑर्डर 20 रुपये+जीएसटी (23.60 रुपये) है।

faqs.question: कितनी वॉचलिस्ट जोड़ी जा सकती हैं?
faqs.answer: आप अधिकतम 5 वॉचलिस्ट जोड़ सकते हैं.

faqs.question: प्रत्येक वॉचलिस्ट में कितने स्टॉक जोड़े जा सकते हैं?
faqs.answer: आप प्रति वॉचलिस्ट 50 स्टॉक तक जोड़ सकते हैं।

faqs.question: मैं एक निगरानी सूची कैसे बना सकता हूँ?
faqs.answer:
आप इन चरणों का पालन करके एक वॉचलिस्ट बना सकते हैं।

वॉचलिस्ट स्क्रीन पर जाएं.

वेब और मोबाइल ऐप पर, आपको नई वॉचलिस्ट बनाने के लिए + आइकन मिलेगा।

वॉचलिस्ट को नाम दें और क्रिएट पर क्लिक करें।

आप स्टॉक खोज सकते हैं और उन्हें बनाई गई वॉचलिस्ट में जोड़ सकते हैं।

faqs.question: Where can I find my UPI ID?
faqs.answer: Generally, you can find your UPI ID in the profile section of the respective app you are using.

faqs.question: I don’t have a UPI ID. Can I apply for an IPO?
faqs.answer:
In case you don’t have a UPI ID, you can create it with any of the UPI Handles featured in the NPCI list.

Alternatively, you can apply through ASBA with your bank or through physical form.

faqs.question: How can I create my UPI ID?
faqs.answer:
You can follow the below steps to create a UPI ID with the BHIM app

Download the Google Pay/ PhonePe / BHIM App

Verify your mobile number

Register the passcode (it is required to open the app)

Select your bank from the options available

The app will fetch your bank details

In case you have more than one account, choose the account you want to register with BHIM

Set up a UPI PIN for security

Now you can check your UPI ID in the profile section.

faqs.question: Why am I unable to apply for IPOs via my UPI ID/Handle?
faqs.answer:
For IPO applications, only UPI ID/Handles approved by NPCI are allowed.

In case you are unable to apply for IPO using your UPI ID/Handle, we recommend that you check the list of banks/apps approved by NPCI for providing UPI service for IPO application.

faqs.question: Why can’t I see my UPI handle listed in the dropdown in the Angel One app while applying for an IPO?
faqs.answer:
In case you can’t find your UPI Handle in the dropdown list on the IPO page in the Angel One app, it means your UPI Handle is not approved by NPCI for applying for an IPO.

Try to use or create an alternative UPI ID with any of the entities featured on the NPCI list.

faqs.question: When will I receive my UPI mandate request after placing an order?
faqs.answer:
Below are a few things you can do:

Go to your Payment App – Navigate to the mandate section and check if you have an open mandate or not.

In case you have received many mandates then you can cross verify with the Application ID mentioned in the mandate details with the Application ID mentioned in the order details from Angel One’s Application

OR

Make sure your Payments App is updated.

OR

If it is taking longer than 6 hours then cancel your bid from Angel one’s application and place a new bid.

faqs.question: How to approve an IPO mandate request?
faqs.answer: You have to approve the IPO mandate request in your UPI app.

faqs.question: By when can I approve the UPI mandate request?
faqs.answer: Pending mandates shall expire after 5 PM on the last day. So users should accept the mandate before 5 PM on the last day to participate in the IPO.

faqs.question: What are the charges of applying for an IPO?
faqs.answer: With Angel One, there are no charges to apply for an IPO.

faqs.question: How can an NRI apply for an IPO using the Angel One app?
faqs.answer:
NRI’s can not apply via the Angel One app.

However, they can apply through the physical ASBA (Application Supported By Blocked Amount) process with your bank.

faqs.question: What is the cut-off price & why should I apply at a cut-off price?
faqs.answer:
Cut-off price is the price at which the shares get issued through an IPO to the investors.

This price is ascertained at the allotment stage.

When an investor applies for an IPO at a cut-off price, that means he is ready to bid at this price.

In an ideal scenario, all retail investors bid at the cut-off price to increase their chance of allotment.

faqs.question: Can I use a bank account not linked with Angel One to apply?
faqs.answer: You can apply for an IPO using any other bank account provided the account is in the name of the investor.

faqs.question: Can I apply for an IPO using my bank’s current account?
faqs.answer:
It is preferred that you apply using your savings account as most banks do not process IPO applications submitted using a current account.

You need to check with your bank for more details.

faqs.question: Can I apply for an IPO using my HUF’s account?
faqs.answer:
You cannot apply via the Angel One app.

However, you can apply using your HUF account through the physical ASBA process with your bank.

faqs.question: My daughter is a minor. Can I apply for an IPO using her account?
faqs.answer:
The Angel One app doesn’t allow a minor to apply.

Although, a minor can apply via physical ASBA process through your bank.

faqs.question: Why didn’t my account get debited after applying for an IPO?
faqs.answer:
As per the ASBA process, banks will simply hold/block your money when you apply for an IPO.

Once the shares are allotted to you, the amount will be debited from your bank account.

If the shares are not allotted to you, the amount will be unblocked/released to your account on/before the UPI mandate expiry date.

Note: Banks usually take 10-15 days to release your funds.

If your funds are still blocked after 15 days please contact your bank .

faqs.question: Can I modify my IPO bid?
faqs.answer:
Yes, you can modify the lot size and UPI ID of your IPO bid after placing an order.

Please note that if you have approved your UPI mandate request for the order and modified the order later, the entire IPO bid amount will be blocked in addition to the amount blocked for your original IPO bid.

You will also receive another UPI mandate request for your modified bid.

However, if you haven’t approved the original mandate request, no amount will be blocked for the original IPO bid.

faqs.question: Why is my IPO application rejected?
faqs.answer:
Few of the common reasons your IPO application is rejected

You might have entered the wrong UPI ID or UPI PIN while approving the mandate

Ensuring that the Bank A/c, Demat A/c, and UPI ID are mapped to the same PAN
For example: Jack is using Jill’s UPI ID to apply for an IPO with his Demat A/c. In such a case, Jack’s application will be rejected because

Jill’s bank account used is not linked to the demat account of Jack

Jill’s UPI ID used is not linked to Jack’s PAN

faqs.question: When will my funds be blocked and unblocked?
faqs.answer:
Your funds will be blocked once you approve the UPI mandate request for IPO.

Your funds will be unblocked/released on or before the UPI mandate expiry date if the shares are not allotted through IPO.

Please reach out to your bank in case funds are not unblocked/released post the mandate expiry date.

faqs.question: How can I get a guaranteed IPO allotment?
faqs.answer:
We would like to explain that Angel One is merely a platform to apply for IPO and has no control over its allotment. IPO allotment can never be guaranteed since, in case of over-subscription, the allotment is done via a lottery system. However, you can avoid application rejection by

Applying from only 1 Demat account per PAN

Applying at cut-off price

Ensuring that the Bank A/c, Demat A/c, and UPI ID are mapped to the same PAN
For example: Jack is using Jill’s UPI ID to apply for an IPO with his Demat A/c. In such a case, Jack’s application will be rejected because

Jill’s bank A/C used is not linked to the Demat A/c of Jack

Jill’s UPI ID used is not linked to Jack’s PAN

faqs.question: Where can I check my refund status in case of a rejected/non-allotted IPO application?
faqs.answer:
Banks will simply hold/block your money when you apply for an IPO.

So, your funds will be released/unblocked on or before the UPI mandate expiry date.

Please reach out to your bank in case funds are not unblocked or released post the mentioned date.

faqs.question: Why didn’t I get my IPO allotment?
faqs.answer:
Common reasons why you didn’t get the allotment are

Non-Allotment – Allotment is done through lottery system because of over-subscription
Rejection – Application can be rejected due to either of the following reasons:

1) Application received from multiple Demat accounts having the same PAN

2) Bank account Demat account, and UPI ID used for an application not mapped to the same PAN

3) Your bid price is lower than the final issue price

faqs.question: Is tax applicable on profit from an IPO?
faqs.answer: Tax will be levied on your profit as per your tax bracket.

faqs.question: When is the next IPO coming?
faqs.answer: Visit our website https://www.angelone.in/upcoming-IPO to get all information about forthcoming IPO’s.

faqs.question: I have approved the mandate request, but the status on the Angel One app is still pending. What to do?
faqs.answer:
Your UPI mandate request status on the Angel One app does not get updated in real-time.

It will reflect shortly in your IPO order book.

faqs.question: Can I withdraw/delete/cancel my IPO bid?
faqs.answer:
For an IPO application process in the Angel One app, withdrawing, deleting, and canceling the application is the same thing.

Follow the below path to withdraw/cancel your IPO application

Tap on IPO on the Home page

Click on IPO orders & click on the IPO Order you wish to cancel

Tap on cancel & confirm to cancel your IPO Order

faqs.question: How can I check my IPO application status?
faqs.answer:
Follow the below path to check your IPO application status

Tap on IPO on the Home page

Click on IPO orders & click on the IPO Order for which you want to check the application status

Your IPO application status will be visible from here

faqs.question: Where to check the IPO allotment status?
faqs.answer:
Follow the below path to check your subscription status

Tap on IPO on the Home page

Click on IPO orders & click on the IPO Order for which you want to check the subscription status

Your IPO subscription status will be visible from here

faqs.question: Can I submit multiple applications for an IPO?
faqs.answer: Only 1 application per PAN is recommended. Even if you apply via different platforms using the same PAN, your application will be rejected and you will not get the IPO allotment. However, you can increase the chances of IPO allotment by applying with different account linked to different PAN. For example, you can apply with your and your parents demat account separately.

faqs.question: Why is my IPO application rejected?
faqs.answer:
Few of the common reasons your IPO application is rejected

You might have entered the wrong UPI ID or UPI PIN while approving the mandate

Ensuring that the Bank A/c, Demat A/c, and UPI ID are mapped to the same PAN
For example: Jack is using Jill’s UPI ID to apply for an IPO with his Demat A/c. In such a case, Jack’s application will be rejected because

Jill’s bank account used is not linked to the demat account of Jack

Jill’s UPI ID used is not linked to Jack’s PAN

faqs.question: When will my funds be blocked and unblocked?
faqs.answer:
Your funds will be blocked once you approve the UPI mandate request for IPO.

Your funds will be unblocked/released on or before the UPI mandate expiry date if the shares are not allotted through IPO.

Please reach out to your bank in case funds are not unblocked/released post the mandate expiry date.

faqs.question: How can I get a guaranteed IPO allotment?
faqs.answer:
We would like to explain that Angel One is merely a platform to apply for IPO and has no control over its allotment. IPO allotment can never be guaranteed since, in case of over-subscription, the allotment is done via a lottery system. However, you can avoid application rejection by

Applying from only 1 Demat account per PAN

Applying at cut-off price

Ensuring that the Bank A/c, Demat A/c, and UPI ID are mapped to the same PAN
For example: Jack is using Jill’s UPI ID to apply for an IPO with his Demat A/c. In such a case, Jack’s application will be rejected because

Jill’s bank A/C used is not linked to the Demat A/c of Jack

Jill’s UPI ID used is not linked to Jack’s PAN

faqs.question: Where can I check my refund status in case of a rejected/non-allotted IPO application?
faqs.answer:
Banks will simply hold/block your money when you apply for an IPO.

So, your funds will be released/unblocked on or before the UPI mandate expiry date.

Please reach out to your bank in case funds are not unblocked or released post the mentioned date.

faqs.question: Why didn’t I get my IPO allotment?
faqs.answer:
Common reasons why you didn’t get the allotment are

Non-Allotment – Allotment is done through lottery system because of over-subscription
Rejection – Application can be rejected due to either of the following reasons:

1) Application received from multiple Demat accounts having the same PAN

2) Bank account Demat account, and UPI ID used for an application not mapped to the same PAN

3) Your bid price is lower than the final issue price

faqs.question: Is tax applicable on profit from an IPO?
faqs.answer: Tax will be levied on your profit as per your tax bracket.

faqs.question: When is the next IPO coming?
faqs.answer: Visit our website https://www.angelone.in/upcoming-IPO to get all information about forthcoming IPO’s.

faqs.question: I have approved the mandate request, but the status on the Angel One app is still pending. What to do?
faqs.answer:
Your UPI mandate request status on the Angel One app does not get updated in real-time.

It will reflect shortly in your IPO order book.

faqs.question: Can I withdraw/delete/cancel my IPO bid?
faqs.answer:
For an IPO application process in the Angel One app, withdrawing, deleting, and canceling the application is the same thing.

Follow the below path to withdraw/cancel your IPO application

Tap on IPO on the Home page

Click on IPO orders & click on the IPO Order you wish to cancel

Tap on cancel & confirm to cancel your IPO Order

faqs.question: How can I check my IPO application status?
faqs.answer:
Follow the below path to check your IPO application status

Tap on IPO on the Home page

Click on IPO orders & click on the IPO Order for which you want to check the application status

Your IPO application status will be visible from here

faqs.question: Where to check the IPO allotment status?
faqs.answer:
Follow the below path to check your subscription status

Tap on IPO on the Home page

Click on IPO orders & click on the IPO Order for which you want to check the subscription status

Your IPO subscription status will be visible from here

faqs.question: Can I submit multiple applications for an IPO?
faqs.answer: Only 1 application per PAN is recommended. Even if you apply via different platforms using the same PAN, your application will be rejected and you will not get the IPO allotment. However, you can increase the chances of IPO allotment by applying with different account linked to different PAN. For example, you can apply with your and your parents demat account separately.

faqs.question: How can I place a bid for OFS?
faqs.answer: As of now, we do not have an online facility for OFS order placement. You can Call us / Write to us by visiting the link at the bottom of the page.

faqs.question: At what time can I bid for an Offer for Sale (OFS)?
faqs.answer: You can place your bid for OFS from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM on the OFS date.

faqs.question: Can I modify or cancel my Offer for Sale bid?
faqs.answer:
Yes, cancellation and modification of orders are possible before 3:20 PM.

As of now, we do not have an online facility for OFS order cancellation/modification. You can Call us / Write to us by visiting the link at the bottom of the page.

faqs.question: Where can I find a list of Upcoming & past OFS?
faqs.answer:
Click the link below to get the list of Upcoming & Past OFS

https://www1.nseindia.com/live_market/content/live_watch/offer_sale/ofs_sale.htm

faqs.question: At what time can I bid for an Offer for Sale (OFS)?
faqs.answer: You can place your bid for OFS from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM on the OFS date.

faqs.question: How many shares can I buy in an OFS?
faqs.answer:
There is no specific lot size required.

You can bid even for one share.

However, if there is a lot size specified by the Seller as mentioned in the OFS announcement notice, orders placed in the specified lot size only will be accepted

faqs.question: When will the funds get debited for my OFS bid?
faqs.answer:
Ledger amount will be blocked during the time of bidding.

If your OFS bid has been accepted and you have been allotted shares, your account will be debited for the appropriate amount at End of Trading Day.

Shares will be credited on the next T+2 days

In case of oversubscription, shares will be allotted on a pro-rata basis

You can also place a bid using the Margin available in your account.

However, ensure you have sufficient Margin while making the bid.

To find out your Margin, visit your Fund section on the Angel One app

faqs.question: When would the OFS shares get credited into my Demat account?
faqs.answer: If your OFS bid has been accepted and you have been allotted shares, the same will be credited to your Demat account on T + 2 days.

faqs.question: What does Retail & Non-Retail category mean?
faqs.answer:
Retail category is for Individual Investors with a limit of Rs 2,00,000/- for Individual bids.

Non Retail category is for Organizations, FII, etc. with a bid limit greater than 2 lakhs

faqs.question: If allotted, how soon can I sell off my shares?
faqs.answer: Once the shares get credited into your Demat account and reflect in your Portfolio holdings, you can place your sell order any time after that.

faqs.question: What is the difference between the Floor price and cut-off price?
faqs.answer:
Floor Price is the lowest price at which you can place your bid. This price is provided by sellers.

Cut off Price is the lowest price at which the OFS issue gets subscribed. This price differs for the Retail and Non Retail Categories.

faqs.question: Can I buy OFS using MTF (Margin Trading Facility)?
faqs.answer: No, it’s not possible to bid for OFS using MTF.

faqs.question: Can I place multiple bids for Offer for Sale?
faqs.answer:
Yes you can place multiple bids for Offer for Sale.

Further, investors opting for multiple orders across Exchanges should be aware that all bids in the Retail category amounting to more than Rs 2,00,000 will be rejected.

faqs.question: What is Sovereign Gold Bond (SGB) & who is the issuer?
faqs.answer:
SGBs are government securities denominated in grams of gold.

They are an alternate to holding physical gold.

SGBs are issued by RBI on behalf of the Government of India.

faqs.question: Why should I buy SGB rather than physical gold & what are the benefits?
faqs.answer:
SGBs offer investors with a range of benefits, such as

The quantity of gold for which the investor pays is protected, since he receives the ongoing market price at the time of redemption/ premature redemption.

No risks and costs of physical storage.

No making charges and purity issues

Earn interest at 2.5% per year on the initial investment.& Interest is credited twice a year.

faqs.question: Are there any risks in investing in SGBs?
faqs.answer:
There may be a risk of capital loss if the market price of gold declines.

However, the investor does not lose in terms of the units of gold that he/she has paid for.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to invest in the SGBs?
faqs.answer:
All Indian residents as defined under Foreign Exchange Management Act, of 1999 are eligible to invest in SGBs.

Eligible investors include individuals, HUFs, trusts, universities and charitable institutions.

faqs.question: Whether joint holding will be allowed?
faqs.answer: Yes, joint holding is allowed.

faqs.question: Can a Minor invest in SGB?
faqs.answer: Yes. The application on behalf of the minor has to be made by his/her guardian.

faqs.question: What is the minimum and maximum limit for investment?
faqs.answer:
The Bonds are issued in denominations of one gram of gold and in multiples thereof.

Minimum investment in the Bond shall be one gram with a maximum limit of subscription of 4 kg for individuals, 4 kg for Hindu Undivided Family (HUF) and 20 kg for trusts and similar entities notified by the government from time to time per fiscal year (April-March).

In case of joint holding, the limit applies to the first applicant.

The annual ceiling will include bonds subscribed under different tranches during initial issuance by Government and those purchased from the secondary market. The ceiling on investment will not include the holdings as collateral by banks and other Financial Institutions.

faqs.question: What is the rate of interest and how will the interest be paid?
faqs.answer:
The Bonds bear interest at the rate of 2.50% (fixed rate) per annum on the amount of initial investment.

Interest will be credited semi-annually to the bank account of the investor and the last interest will be payable on maturity along with the principal.

There will be no capital gain tax at maturity.

faqs.question: At what price the bonds are sold?
faqs.answer: The nominal value of Gold Bonds shall be in Indian Rupees fixed on the basis of simple average of closing price of gold of 999 purity, published by the India Bullion and Jewelers Association Limited, for the last 3 business days of the week preceding the subscription period.

faqs.question: Will RBI publish the rate of gold applicable every day?
faqs.answer: The price of gold for the relevant tranche will be published on the RBI website two days before the issue opens.

faqs.question: What will I get on redemption?
faqs.answer: On maturity, the Gold Bonds shall be redeemed in Indian Rupees and the redemption price shall be based on simple average of closing price of gold of 999 purity of previous 3 business days from the date of repayment, published by the India Bullion and Jewelers Association Limited.

faqs.question: How will I get the redemption amount?
faqs.answer: Interest and redemption proceeds will be credited to the bank account furnished by the customer at the time of buying the bond.

faqs.question: What are the procedures involved during redemption?
faqs.answer:
The investor will be advised one month before maturity regarding the ensuing maturity of the bond.

On the date of maturity, the maturity proceeds will be credited to the registered bank account.

faqs.question: Can I encash the bond anytime I want? Is premature redemption allowed?
faqs.answer:
Though the tenor of the bond is 8 years, early encashment/redemption of the bond is allowed after the fifth year from the date of issue.

The bond can be traded on Exchanges, if held in demat form. It can also be transferred to any other eligible investor.

faqs.question: Can I gift the bonds to a relative or friend on some occasion?
faqs.answer: The bond can be gifted/transferred to a relative/friend/anybody who fulfills the eligibility criteria

faqs.question: Is tax deducted at source (TDS) applicable on the bond?
faqs.answer: TDS is not applicable to the bond. However, it is the responsibility of the bond holder to comply with the tax laws.

faqs.question: Can I trade these bonds?
faqs.answer:
The bonds are tradable from a date to be notified by RBI. (It may be noted that only bonds held in demat form with depositories can be traded on stock exchanges)

The bonds can also be sold and transferred as per provisions of Government Securities Act, 2006. Partial transfer of bonds is also possible.

faqs.question: What is Stock SIP?
faqs.answer:
Stock SIP is a tool that helps you create wealth, by regularly investing small amounts in stocks & ETF’s of your choice as per your risk profile.

To know more about Stock SIP Click Here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/online-share-trading/equity-sip)

faqs.question: What is the frequency of Stock SIP?
faqs.answer: The frequency for Stock SIP is Daily, Weekly or Monthly.

faqs.question: When will my Stock SIP orders be placed?
faqs.answer: Your Stock SIP orders will be placed between 11:00 am to 1:00 pm on the SIP day on a best-effort basis.

faqs.question: Are there any additional charges for Stock SIP?
faqs.answer: There are no additional charges for Stock SIP. However, you will be charged the normal brokerage as per your brokerage plan.

faqs.question: From where will my funds be debited for my Stock SIP order?
faqs.answer:
Funds will be debited from your Angel One ledger for your Stock SIP order on the SIP debit date.

Please maintain sufficient balance in your Angel One Ledger on the SIP debit date.

faqs.question: How can I place a Stock SIP Order?
faqs.answer:
Tap on Stock SIP in the Tools Option on the Home page

Add the stock for which you want to create a SIP

Enter the amount, start date, frequency & click on Create Stock SIP

Your Stock SIP will be successfully created

faqs.question: How can I cancel my Stock SIP order?
faqs.answer:
Tap on Orders at the bottom of the page.

Click on Stock SIP & select the SIP you wish to cancel

Tap on cancel SIP & submit

Your Stock SIP will be successfully cancelled

faqs.question: What happens if I don't pay back OR miss EMI repayments on the Loan?
faqs.answer: If you miss or fail to repay your EMIs on the loan, it can negatively affect your credit score and may lead to additional charges or legal action. We strongly urge you to avoid missing your loan monthly installment payments.

faqs.question: How can I pay my missed EMI or foreclose the loan?
faqs.answer:
If your EMI is not cleared from your bank account via the auto debit E-NACH mandate on the due date due to inadvertent circumstances, you can pay it yourself through the Angel One app. Follow these steps:

• Open the Angel One app.

• Navigate to the loan pass book.

• Use the “Pay Now” section to make the payment via net banking or debit card.

Alternatively, the EMI mandate will be represented for auto debit from your bank account.

To foreclose the loan, you can also use the Angel One app to find the option to foreclose and complete the payment using the same methods.

faqs.answer: Presently, we do not have the feature to facilitate the change of the bank account used to set up the EMI mandate. We urge you to continue servicing your EMI through the bank account that was used at the time of loan disbursement.

faqs.question: When can I foreclose my loan?

faqs.question: How do I check if I am eligible to apply for a personal loan?
faqs.answer: Currently, Angel One is offering personal loans via its lending partners to a select group of existing users only. We will gradually be rolling out the product to more users. Stay tuned for updates!

faqs.question: What is the maximum sum of money that I can borrow?
faqs.answer: The amount you can borrow depends on your profile. Currently, the maximum loan amount offered is Rs 5 Lakhs.

faqs.question: What documents will I have to submit when applying for a personal loan?
faqs.answer:
When applying for a personal loan, you may need to submit the following documents:

• Aadhaar and PAN for KYC approval

• Bank account details for cash disbursal

• Selfie and signature for user identification

faqs.question: Can I add a prepaid amount of EMI in principal instead of Interest?
faqs.answer: No, this option is not available currently.

faqs.question: Where do I get the loan application form?
faqs.answer: Once you go to the loans tab on our Angel One platform, you will see the loan application form there. Please note: Only Angel One eligible customers will see the loans tab on our platform.

faqs.question: Can I apply for a joint loan with my spouse?
faqs.answer: No, we do not allow joint loan applications.

faqs.question: I live out of the country and work from a remote location, will I be eligible for a personal loan?
faqs.answer: No, we only disburse personal loans to Indian citizens currently residing in India.

faqs.question: I'm an NRI. Can I avail of a personal loan?
faqs.answer: No, we only disburse personal loans to Indian citizens currently residing in India.

faqs.question: Can I use my Angel One holdings as collateral for availing of personal loans?

faqs.question: How much interest will I be charged?
faqs.answer: The interest rate and applicable EMIs are shown to you during the loan application process before you avail the loan.

faqs.question: How can a NACH/eNACH setup help?
faqs.answer:
NACH/eNACH Mandate is a repayment service that automates monthly recurring payments, such as loan EMIs. This setup ensures that:

• Your monthly EMIs are automatically collected from your bank account on the due date.

• You don’t miss any EMI payments, helping you maintain a good credit history.

• It simplifies the repayment process, saving you time and effort.

faqs.question: Are there any advantages in applying for a personal loan online?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applying for a personal loan online offers several advantages:

• Convenience: You can apply from anywhere with just a few clicks.

• Quick Processing: Submit necessary documents online and get money in your account within the same day.

• Seamless Experience: The entire process is smooth and efficient, saving you time and effort.

faqs.question: Is there any offer for women/senior citizens?
faqs.answer: No, there are no special offers for women or senior citizens. However, if you have a good history with Angel One, we may provide attractive offers to you.

faqs.question: Is prepayment allowed for personal loans?
faqs.answer: No, prepayment is not allowed for personal loans at the moment.

faqs.question: Can I change my EMI due date?
faqs.answer: No, you cannot change your EMI due date once the loan is approved and disbursed.

faqs.question: Can I change my EMI date once the loan EMI has started?
faqs.answer: No, there is no option to change the EMI date currently.

faqs.question: How is the personal loan disbursed?
faqs.answer: Once your loan application is approved, the loan amount will be disbursed to your registered bank account within 24 hours.

faqs.question: Is there any balance transfer offer on a personal loan? Are there any benefits to this balance transfer?
faqs.answer: No, there is no balance transfer option available for personal loans currently.

faqs.question: What is the maximum tenure of loan?
faqs.answer: The loan tenure at Angel One varies based on the customer’s profile. We thoroughly assess each user’s profile to determine the most suitable tenure.

faqs.question: What is the processing fee for a loan?
faqs.answer: The processing fee depends on your profile and will be specified during the application process.

faqs.question: How can I track my loan application?
faqs.answer: You can track your loan application under the ‘Loans’ tab in the Angel One app. All necessary details for verification, tracking, and managing your loan will be available there.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide collateral for a personal loan?
faqs.answer: No, you do not need to provide collateral for a personal loan.

faqs.question: Are personal loan interest rates fixed or floating?
faqs.answer: Our lending partners charge a fixed interest rate for personal loans. This means your EMI amount remains the same every month throughout the loan tenure.

faqs.question: What are the fees? Why should I pay them? Are there hidden fees?
faqs.answer: All applicable charges are clearly shown in the Loan Agreement, Sanction Letter, and Key Fact Statement (KFS). Please read these documents carefully while accepting the loan terms and conditions during the application process. There are no hidden fees.

faqs.question: Is there any restriction for usage of the loan amount or can I use it to pay up any other loan?
faqs.answer: You can use the personal loan amount at your discretion, including paying off other loans. However, it is crucial to use the loan for legal purposes and ensure timely repayment to avoid any serious actions against you.

faqs.question: How does CIBIL affect my loan approval process?
faqs.answer: We check your CIBIL score to determine your eligibility for a personal loan.

faqs.question: What is the foreclosure process, and is there a minimum lock-in period?
faqs.answer: There is no lock-in period for foreclosure. You can initiate foreclosure through the app.

faqs.question: What are the foreclosure charges for a loan?
faqs.answer: Foreclosure charges, or full prepayment charges, depend on the lender. Specific details will be provided by your lender.

faqs.question: Can I get a top-up loan after taking a personal loan?
faqs.answer: No, we are still working on that product.

faqs.question: Do I have to pay any additional charges for foreclosure?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreclosure charges will be levied. These charges vary depending on factors such as the loan amount and tenure. The charges tend to be higher if you choose to close your loan earlier.

faqs.question: What is a credit report and score?
faqs.answer:
Credit Report: A credit report is a detailed record of your credit history and financial behaviour. It includes information about:

• Your credit accounts

• Payment history

• Outstanding debts

• Inquiries made by lenders

Credit Score: A credit score is a numerical representation of your creditworthiness based on the information in your credit report.

faqs.question: What are the factors that affect my credit score?
faqs.answer:
Your credit score is influenced by several factors:

• Payment History: Consistency in repaying debts on time.

• Credit Utilisation: The ratio of your current credit card balances to your credit limits.

• Length of Credit History: The duration of your credit accounts.

• Types of Credit: A mix of different types of credit accounts (e.g., credit cards, loans).

• Recent Credit Inquiries: Number of recent applications for new credit.

faqs.question: What do the terms settlement, default, and closed mean? Do they affect my credit score?
faqs.answer:
1. Settlement:

• Occurs when you negotiate with a creditor to pay less than the full amount owed.

• It resolves the debt but is noted on your credit report.

• Can negatively impact your credit score.

2. Default:

• Happens when you fail to make required payments on time, breaching the loan agreement.

• Significantly harms your credit score.

• May lead to legal actions or collections.

3. Closed:

• Refers to an account that has been fully paid off and is no longer active.

• Can affect the length of your credit history, which is a factor in credit scoring.

All three terms can impact your credit score:

• Settlements and defaults: Negatively impact your score.

• Closed accounts: Indirectly influence your score by affecting the length of your credit history.

faqs.question: What is the Annual Percentage Rate (APR)?
faqs.answer: The Annual Percentage Rate (APR) represents the overall annual cost of a loan as a percentage. It includes the interest rate and additional charges like processing fees. APR provides a clear understanding of the true borrowing cost, helping you comprehend your actual loan expenditure.

faqs.question: Why was my loan application rejected even though I have a decent salary?
faqs.answer: Your loan application is evaluated based on multiple factors. While your salary is one aspect, other considerations include your credit score, existing debt, and our lender partners’ policies.

faqs.question: Why was my loan application rejected?
faqs.answer: Your application did not meet the requirements of our lender partners’ policies. Therefore, we are unable to offer you a loan at this time.

faqs.question: My loan application was rejected. How can I reapply?
faqs.answer: You will need to wait at least 90 days before you can reapply for a loan after a rejection.

faqs.question: What is my Available Margin to Trade?
faqs.answer: Available Margin to Trade consists of your Funds balance & margin against eligible holdings.

faqs.question: How to increase my Available Margin to Trade?
faqs.answer: You can increase your Available Margin to Trade by adding Funds or by creating a Margin Pledge against your eligible holdings in Accounts -> Stock Pledging.

faqs.question: What is Peak Margin requirement?
faqs.answer: Peak Margin is the minimum margin that must be collected by brokers from their clients in advance of placing any intraday / delivery order.

faqs.question: What is Peak Margin Shortfall?
faqs.answer:
Peak Margin shortfall occurs when you buy a share from 80% margin released against delivery sell transactions and such sell position is subsequently bought back.

You will be charged a penalty if margin shortfall is due to insufficient margin.

faqs.question: I want to know how much cash is mine and how much is on margin?
faqs.answer: You can check your available cash and margin by visiting Account → Trading balance screen on web or mobile app. Here you will see the Cash balance and the margins from pledge holdings

faqs.question: Where can I see my account balance?
faqs.answer:
Tap on Account at the bottom of your screen

Trading balance is shown at on the card at the top of the page

Click on Trading balance card to view more details about the funds

faqs.question: What is my Available Margin to Trade?
faqs.answer: Available Margin to Trade consists of your Funds balance & margin against eligible holdings.

faqs.question: How to increase my Available Margin to Trade?
faqs.answer: You can increase your Available Margin to Trade by adding Funds or by creating a Margin Pledge against your eligible holdings in Accounts -> Stock Pledging.

faqs.question: What is Peak Margin requirement?
faqs.answer: Peak Margin is the minimum margin that must be collected by brokers from their clients in advance of placing any intraday / delivery order.

faqs.question: What is Peak Margin Shortfall?
faqs.answer:
Peak Margin shortfall occurs when you buy a share from 80% margin released against delivery sell transactions and such sell position is subsequently bought back.

You will be charged a penalty if margin shortfall is due to insufficient margin.

faqs.question: I want to know how much cash is mine and how much is on margin?
faqs.answer: You can check your available cash and margin by visiting Account → Trading balance screen on web or mobile app. Here you will see the Cash balance and the margins from pledge holdings

faqs.question: What is Margin Pledge?
faqs.answer: Margin Pledge also called stock pledge refers to the process of using your existing stocks as collateral for availing additional limits.

faqs.question: What are the charges for Margin Pledge?
faqs.answer:
Pledging of shares is charged a flat transaction fee, irrespective of the quantity pledged. Hence, the fee charged is per scrip and not the volume. So, these charges remain the same whether you pledge 1 share or 100 shares.

Charges per scrip are Rs 20+GST. The split is as below.

INR 5 (Depository) + INR 15 (Angel One Charge) + GST

faqs.question: What is Unpledging of shares?
faqs.answer: Unpledging of shares means release of pledge by paying off the loan amount or clearing your ledger debits & associated dues

faqs.question: What are the charges for Unpledging of shares?
faqs.answer:
Unpledging of shares are charged a flat transaction fee, irrespective of the quantity unpledged.

Hence, the fee charged is per scrip and not the volume.

So, these charges remain the same whether you un-pledge 1 share or 100 shares.

Charges per scrip are Rs 20 +GST.

faqs.question: What is the process for Margin Pledge?
faqs.answer:
Tap on Account at the bottom of your page

Scroll down to Stock Pledging & click on Pledge stocks

Click on Increase & select the quantity & shares you wish to pledge

Click on Increase Margin

Enter OTP by Angel One

You will be redirected to the CDSL website where you need to enter the OTP sent by CDSL on your registered mobile number

Post entering the OTP click on Verify

Once the pledge is approved, margins will be provided against the pledged stock within 15 minutes

faqs.question: Where can I see the status of my Margin Pledge request?
faqs.answer:
Tap on Account at the bottom of your page

Scroll down to Stock Pledging & click on Pledge stocks

Click on Margin Pledge Transactions

You will be able to see your Margin Pledge transactions from here

faqs.question: How to Unpledge shares?
faqs.answer:
Tap on Account at the bottom of your page

Scroll down to Stock Pledging & click on Pledge stocks

Click on Withdraw & select the stocks that you need to Unpledge

Click on Withdraw Margin

The stocks will be Unpledged on T+1 day if margin requirements are fulfilled

faqs.question: Where can I see the status of my Unpledge request?
faqs.answer:
Tap on Account at the bottom of your page

Scroll down to Stock Pledging & click on Pledge stocks

Click on Margin Pledge Transactions

You will be able to see your Margin Unpledge transactions from here

faqs.question: What is Margin Trading Facility (MTF)?
faqs.answer:
Margin Trading Facility (MTF) allows an investor to buy a stock by paying just a fraction of the total transaction value. The balance amount is funded by the broker.

As an illustration

Your Account Balance = Rs. 25,000

MTF gives you upto 4x buying power = Rs 100,000 (25,000 x 4)

Thus, your enhanced Buying Capacity is now = Rs. 125,000.

faqs.question: What is Margin required?
faqs.answer:
Margin required is the amount you need to pay initially to buy stocks under margin products.

Margin amount can be paid either in the form of Cash, or by pledging your holdings (margin pledge).

faqs.question: What happens if the margin is less?
faqs.answer:
In order to buy stocks under Margin Trading Facility, you need to fulfil the Minimum Margin requirement.

If your margin is less than that, then you will have to add funds to proceed with your transaction.

faqs.question: What is the interest rate charged for using MTF?
faqs.answer: A standard interest rate of 0.041% per day (14.97% per annum) is charged on the borrowed amount.

faqs.question: How long can I hold the stocks purchased via MTF?
faqs.answer: In case you have pledged the shares, you can hold them as long as you want unless you either sell your Pay Later (MTF) positions or convert them to delivery by adding funds.

faqs.question: When will I start incurring interest charges?
faqs.answer: Interest is levied from the 2nd day onwards after you placed an MTF trade, till the outstanding amount is cleared, and/or your position is squared-off.

faqs.question: What is MTF Pledge?
faqs.answer: As per SEBI guidelines, your shares bought using PayLater(MTF) will be automatically pledged. There is no action needed from your end

faqs.question: When would my shares purchased under MTF be squared-off?
faqs.answer:
For shares purchased under MTF, square-off will be triggered in either of the below scenarios:

If there is a margin shortfall, shares will be squared-off 4 trading days after the shortfall has occurred.

faqs.question: What are the charges for Pledging/Un-pledging shares under MTF?
faqs.answer: When you raise a request to Pledge or Unpledge your shares, charge of Rs 20/- plus GST is levied per scrip.

faqs.question: How is MTF Pledge different from Margin Pledge?
faqs.answer:
Margin Pledge means using your existing holdings / portfolio to get additional limit / margin. You can then use this additional margin for Equity Intraday, futures & options writing (equity and currency F&O).

As per SEBI guidelines, shares bought under MTF have to be compulsorily pledged. This is called MTF pledge. Unlike Margin Pledge, you do not get additional limit against these shares.

faqs.question: Can Margin Trading Facility be used for trading in Futures & Options, Currency, or Commodity segment?
faqs.answer: No. MTF Facility is applicable for trading in equity shares only.

faqs.question: I do not want to use Margin Facility. What should I do?
faqs.answer:
If you do not wish to use Margin facility you can place orders using Delivery product type.

Kindly make sure that you have adequate funds before placing your Order.

Kindly check your available funds in the Account -> Trading Balance Summary

faqs.question: What will be the NAV for my order?
faqs.answer:
Applicable NAV is based on realization of fund by respective AMC house and subject to successful order processing by BSE star before cut-offs. Here ‘realization of funds’ means that NAV applicable for your order will depend on if the fund house has receievd money or not

Please find the cut-off timings for various types of funds and orders

Furthermore,

NAV applicability for orders placed on Saturday, Sundays and other market/public holidays depends on when orders are placed on exchange. Here it is the next business day.

Payments made via UPI mode generally result in same-day NAV if the order is placed before cut-off. This happens because settlement to ICCL happens generally happens before cut-off if made via UPI. Angel One depends on payment aggregator for ICCL settlements.

Payments made via Netbanking generally result in next working day’s NAV. This happens as settlement to ICCL does not happen real time and generally takes places on ‘T+1’ basis. Angel One depends on payment aggregator for ICCL settlements. So even if order and payment is successful before cut-off, If the payment mode is netbanking, This might result in next day’s NAV.

In Summary, In some cases, Even if order and payment happens before cut-off, NAV will depend on settlement to ICCL and realization of funds by AMC

faqs.question: I am not able to view my SIP order that I placed recently?
faqs.answer:
Your orders will appear in orders only if you have made the payment today. If you have not selected ‘Make first payment now’. Your SIPs will appear only in SIPS section

To view all your registered SIPs click please go to SIPs section or click on the link below:

Manage SIPs (https://angeloneapp.page.link/?link=https://www.angelone.in/mutual-funds/sipbook/dashboard&apn=com.msf.angelmobile&isi=1060530981&ibi=com.angelbroking.angeleye)

faqs.question: When will my investment appear in my portfolio?
faqs.answer:
Your Investments will appear in your ‘investments Tab’ when your orders moves to ‘Completed’ section of your Orders Tab.

This happens when we get the confirmation of Unit allotment by respective AMCs. This process generally takes 3/4 working days from order placement date.

Your portfolio updation date in Order timeline is our estimate of when Unit allotment confirmation from AMC will come through.

Please do not worry, This date date does not have any relation to your NAV date. Your NAV date depend on realization of funds by AMC.

faqs.question: Why is my instalment order in progress if SIP date is yet to come?
faqs.answer:
We generally create your SIP installment order 2/3 working days before your due date as we have to co-ordinate with your Auto-pay linked bank account well in advance to ensure your SIP instalments goes through smoothly on due date.

Order Date is when we create your SIP instalment order in our system and SIP due date is when money will be debited from your Autopay linked bank account.

NAV applicable is usually of your SIP due date.

faqs.question: When will SIP amount get debited from my bank account for my Active SIPs?
faqs.answer:
Your money will get debited automatically only if your SIP is linked to an autopay.

If your SIP is linked to an autopay. SIP amount will get debited on SIP due date.

faqs.question: Will my order get successful?
faqs.answer:
We have not received confirmation of successful payment from your bank. We will update the status as soon as possible.

Your order will be confirmed when we receive confirmation of payment and confirmation of order placement by exchange. If both this stages are completed successfully. Your order will be successful.

Please don’t worry, If we do not get confirmation or if payment fails. Entire amount will be debited to your source bank account in 4-6 working days.

faqs.question: What will happen if I do not have sufficient balance in my bank account on SIP due date?
faqs.answer:
Your SIP instalment will fail if you do not ensure sufficient balance in your autopay linked bank account.

Your bank can also charge you if you do not ensure sufficient balance in your bank account on SIP due date.

faqs.question: Money got deducted from my bank account but payment status shows payment in progress?
faqs.answer:
We have not received confirmation of successful payment from your bank account. We will update the status as soon as possible.

Please don’t worry, If we do not get confirmation or if payment fails. Entire amount will be debited to your source bank account in 4-6 working days

faqs.question: When will refund happen if money has been debited but order has failed?
faqs.answer: Please don’t worry, If we do not get confirmation or if payment fails. Entire amount will be debited to your source bank account in 4-6 working days.

faqs.question: My money got debited but transaction shows as failed. When will refund happen?
faqs.answer: Please don’t worry, If we do not get payment confirmation or if payment/ order fails. Entire amount will be debited to your source bank account in 4-6 working days.

faqs.question: Will my SIP get created if my order is in Failed state?
faqs.answer:
No, Your SIP will only be created when we received confirmation of successful payment from your bank account.

If payment fails, Your SIP payment will not be registered.

faqs.question: I got less money than what I placed an withdrawal order for?
faqs.answer:
Your withdraw amount is converted to corresponding units while placing order at exchange. We calculate the units to be withdrawn based on current NAVs.

Mutual fund NAVs (Net Asset Value) are updated every day after the market closes from Monday to Friday (All working days)

For example, on June 3rd, you will see the NAV for June 2nd.

Consider the following scenario for withdraw order placed on June 3rd:

If NAV on 3rd June > 2nd June, You will receive an amount greater than order amount.

If NAV on 3rd June < 2nd June, You will receive an amount lesser than order amount.

In Summary, you will receive an amount according to latest NAV.

faqs.question: Will my next instalment be auto-debited?
faqs.answer:
Your next SIP instalment will be Auto-Debited from your bank account if you have a valid Auto-pay setup.

If not please setup an Autopay so that your future SIP instalments can be automated.

To setup an Autopay, Please click below:

{Setup Autopay}

faqs.question: What is Stamp duty?
faqs.answer:
The government collects 0.005% of the overall purchase amount of any mutual fund scheme as stamp duty.

So even if entire amount is debited from your bank account, 0.005 percent of total amount is deducted and hence when order is completed, Same is reflected as invested amount.

faqs.question: My latest investment is not showing up in investments?
faqs.answer:
Your Investments will appear in your ‘Investments’ Tab when your orders moves to ‘Completed’ section of your Orders Tab.

This happens when we get the confirmation of Unit allotment by respective AMCs. This process generally takes 3/4 working days from order placement date.

Your portfolio updation date in Order timeline is our estimate of when Unit allotment confirmation from AMC will come through.

Please do not worry, This date date does not have any relation to your NAV date. Your NAV date depend on realization of funds by AMC.

faqs.question: My Current value is not updated?
faqs.answer:
our Current Value for mutual fund portfolio are calculated based by latest NAVs of funds held by you.

Mutual fund NAVs (Net Asset Value) are updated every day after the market closes from Monday to Friday (All working days)

This means that the Current value you see on a particular day reflects the exact current value as per previous working day.

For example, on June 3rd, you will see the Current Value for June 2nd. The Current Value for June 3rd will be updated later on June 3rd, after the market closes. Therefore, throughout June 3rd, you will view the Current value from June 2nd. On June 4th, you will see Current Value of June 3rd.

As Saturdays and Sundays are considered holidays (along with other market holidays), there are no updates to the Current values on these days as NAV does not change.

However, certain special mutual funds (such as FoF) have their NAV updated once a week. So they current value might change if you hold these funds.

faqs.question: My Mutual fund NAV is not updated
faqs.answer:
Mutual fund NAVs (Net Asset Value) are updated every day after the market closes from Monday to Friday (All working days)

This means that the NAV you see on a particular day reflects the value from the previous working day.

For example, on June 3rd, you will see the NAV for June 2nd. The NAV for June 3rd will be updated later on June 3rd, after the market closes. Therefore, throughout June 3rd, you will view the NAV from June 2nd. On June 4th, you will see NAV of June 3rd.

As Saturdays and Sundays are considered holidays (along with other market holidays), there are no updates to the NAV on these days. However, certain special mutual funds (such as FoF) have their NAV updated once a week.

If you have any concerns about your mutual fund’s NAV is not being updated, please contact us.

Consider the following scenario for withdraw order placed on June 3rd:

If NAV on 3rd June > 2nd June, You will receive an amount greater than order amount.

If NAV on 3rd June < 2nd June, You will receive an amount lesser than order amount.

In Summary, you will receive an amount according to latest NAV.

faqs.question: What is Bonus Issue?
faqs.answer: Bonus shares are additional shares given by the company to existing shareholders, free of cost, in proportion to the shares held by the shareholder.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for bonus shares?
faqs.answer: Shareholders who own shares of the company on the record date set by the company are eligible for bonus shares.

faqs.question: When will the Bonus shares be credited in my demat account?
faqs.answer:
The bonus shares will get credited to your demat account 10-15 days after the record date.

In case you do not receive the same post 15 days from the Record date you can check the status with the Registrar (RTA).

You can find the details of the Registrar on the BSE India website by visiting the Corp Information section.

faqs.question: Why has the average price of the stock reduced after receiving bonus shares?
faqs.answer: The buy price of bonus shares is zero, as they are credited at no cost. When the shares are credited to your account, the quantity of shares increases while the invested value remains unaffected. As a result, the average price of the stock reduces. Be assured that it is correctly calculated by Angel One.
