faqs.question: What is buyback?
faqs.answer: It is a corporate action through which a company buys back its own shares from the holders, generally at a price higher than the market price. Click here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/share-market/effect-of-buyback-on-share-price) to know more about the buyback of shares.

faqs.question: How can I apply for buyback of shares?
faqs.answer:
Here’s how you can apply for a buyback of shares. 

• You will receive a link from the RTA for applying for the buyback issue

• Fill in the relevant details & submit

To understand the detailed procedure, visit here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/online-share-trading/how-to-apply-for-buyback-of-shares).

faqs.question: What is Dividend?
faqs.answer: Dividend is the amount paid by a company to its shareholders out of its profits. To know more about dividend payment click here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/share-market/when-are-stock-dividends-paid-out).

faqs.question: I have not received Dividend for the shares that I am holding in my demat account. What should I do?
faqs.answer:
If you hold your shares in your Demat account on record date then the dividend will be credited to your bank account. However, if those shares are in Pool account, then the dividend will be credited to your Angel One ledger.

The dividend is generally paid 30-45 days after the record date.

In case you do not receive the same post 90 days from the Record date you can check the status with the Registrar (RTA).

You can find the details of the Registrar on the BSE India website by visiting the Corp Information section.

faqs.question: When and where will the dividend amount be credited?
faqs.answer: The dividend will be credited directly to your bank account after 30 to 45 days from the record date.

faqs.question: Will I be eligible for a dividend?
faqs.answer: If you have holdings in your account as of ex-date, you are eligible to receive dividends.

faqs.question: Are there any charges or deductions on dividends?
faqs.answer: No, there are no charges or deductions on the dividend you receive.

faqs.question: Where can I check the dividends?
faqs.answer:
You can create a watchlist by following these steps.

Visit the Portfolio screen.

Click on the specific stock that you are holding.

Scroll to the bottom of screen to find the dividend earned on the stock.

On web, click on the 3 dots that appear when you choose a stock. You will see an option to see the dividend earned.

Please note that you will receive the dividend directly to your bank statement within 30-45 days from the date of dividend payment from the company.

faqs.question: Why are my shares in Pool Account?
faqs.answer:
Shares will be in pool account due to 2 reasons:

Your account is in debit

Shares have not been settled yet. Shares are settled on Trading day + 2 days.

faqs.question: Why are my shares that I sold from my Portfolio shown as negative in Positions tab?
faqs.answer:
Positions tab shows all the positions taken by you today.

A negative quantity indicates a sell transaction whereas a positive quantity indicates a buy transaction.

faqs.question: When will my shares be credited to my demat account?
faqs.answer: Your shares will be credited to your demat account on either T+1 or T+2 trading days depending upon the settlement cycle of the share where T is the trading day.

faqs.question: What are realized and unrealized gains?
faqs.answer:
An unrealized gain/loss is the increase/decrease in the value of an asset or investment that an investor holds but has not yet sold for cash.

It is called unrealized; gain/loss because the investor hasn’t booked the profit/loss until he actually sells that investment.

A gain or loss becomes realized when the investment is actually sold.

faqs.question: How do I check my Portfolio/Holdings?
faqs.answer:
Tap on Portfolio at the bottom of your screen

You will be able to see your Holdings/Portfolio from here

faqs.question: I bought my shares on BSE. Why are they shown on NSE in my Portfolio?
faqs.answer:
We are doing all our settlements in NSE as per our internal policy.

Follow the below path to sell shares in BSE

Click on the share you wish to sell from your Portfolio & tap on Sell

Click on 3 dots on the top right hand corner & change the Exchange from NSE to BSE or vice versa.

Your share will now be sold on BSE

faqs.question: When will my portfolio be updated with my latest investments?
faqs.answer: Your Portfolio will be updated with your latest investments on an immediate basis

faqs.question: Why do I find the average price changed for some stocks in my portfolio?
faqs.answer:
3 things that affect the average price change for certain stocks are: 

• FIFO (First In, First Out) method is used while calculating the average price

• Changes in corporate action handling for certain stocks

• Changes in decimal digits while calculating the average price. 

Here are all the details about the average price change (https://www.angelone.in/blog/average-price-change-know-every-detail) you would want to know.

faqs.question: How to apply for a Rights Issue?
faqs.answer:
Investors can apply for Right Issue shares only through the Application Supported by Blocked Amount i.e. ASBA, either online or offline, if they hold Right Entitlement (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/share-market/what-is-rights-entitlement-know-in-detail) in their demat account. 

Online ASBA Process: Most Self-Certified Syndicate Banks (SCSBs) support the online ASBA application process through Net Banking, similar to an IPO application. Investors should refer to their respective SCSB’s website for detailed instructions on applying for the Rights Issue.

Offline ASBA Process: Alternatively, investors can apply by submitting a filled application form at the nearest branch of an SCSB (Self Certified Syndicate Bank). The list of eligible branches is available on the  SEBI website (https://www.sebi.gov.in/sebiweb/other/OtherAction.do?doRecognisedFpi=yes&intmId=34). The Composite Application form (CAF) can be downloaded from NSE, BSE and RTA websites. 

Investors can also view and download the Rights Issue Application Form (CAF), Offer Letter, Abridged Letter & Entitlement Ratio – Applicable only for registered holders with holdings as of Record Date, from the RTA website. RTA don’t directly accept Right Issue application forms (online/offline). Application needs to be channeled through SCSBs only.

faqs.question: How to obtain the Right Entitlement (RE) ?
faqs.answer:
• Directly from RTA if the investor is eligible for the Right Issue by holding shares of the Company on the record date.

• Purchasing from the Market – Investors can buy Right Entitlement (RE) from the secondary market through the trading platforms such as Angel One, generally identifiable with “-RE” at the end of the stock symbol.

Important Note:

• Holding or purchasing Right Entitlement (RE) does not automatically grant ownership of the Rights Issue shares. Investors must apply for the Rights Issue using their RE before the application deadline. Failure to do so will result in the renouncement of rights, leading to a loss of value.

• The RTA website is only for viewing the Rights Issue Application Form, Offer Letter, Abridged Letter & Entitlement Ratio – Applicable only for registered holders with holdings as of Record Date.

faqs.question: When will the Stock Split impact be visible in my Portfolio?
faqs.answer:
You will receive the Stock Split shares in 3-4 trading days after the record date.

In case you do not receive the same post 5 days from the Record date you can check the status with the Registrar (RTA).

You can find the details of the Registrar on the BSE India website by visiting the Corp Information section.

faqs.question: What is a stock split?
faqs.answer: Stock split (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/share-market/what-is-stock-split) is a corporate action in which a company issues more shares to its existing shareholders by reducing the face value of each share as predecided.

faqs.question: What is stock consolidation?
faqs.answer: It is an action taken by a company where they reduce the number of outstanding shares by combining the shares as well as increasing the face value. It is also known as a reverse stock split (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/share-market/everything-about-stock-consolidation-and-how-to-trade).

faqs.question: What are record and ex-split dates?
faqs.answer:
The record date is the date on which the company checks its records to identify the eligible shareholders for a stock split. Please note that the record date and ex-date are the same.

Ex- split date is the date on which the stock starts trading at the new adjusted split price.

faqs.question: What is TPIN?
faqs.answer:
TPIN stands for Transaction Personal Identification Number.

CDSL has introduced TPIN, which will enable investors to authorise selling securities from their demat accounts virtually.

For Non POA clients, TPIN verification will be valid for 1 day.

Once you generate TPIN, it will be valid till you generate it again. Hence, please make a note of your TPIN for quicker verification.

An OTP will also be required apart from TPIN for selling shares from demat account.

faqs.question: How do I generate TPIN?
faqs.answer:
Follow the below steps to generate a new TPIN.

• Go to Portfolio section on the App.

• Click on Verify to Sell.

• You will be redirected to CDSL website.

• Now you can either enter the existing TPIN or click on the option to generate TPIN.

• If you choose to generate TPIN, you will need to enter BO ID and PAN details.

• You can find your BO ID in Account → Profile section of the App (Also called as DP ID).

• Once you enter BO ID & PAN and then OTP, your TPIN will be sent to your mobile number and email ID.

• Please make a note of your TPIN so that you can reuse it later.

faqs.question: How can I sell stocks without TPIN verification?
faqs.answer: You will have to activate DDPI in order to sell stocks without TPIN verification. For entire process to activate DDPI, click here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/demat-account/how-to-set-up-ddpi-on-angel-one). You can check your DDPI status on our platform by visiting Account → Profile → View All Categories (under personal details).

faqs.question: What is Client Master List?
faqs.answer:
Client Master List (CML) is a document with details of your DEMAT account providing your information such as name, address, DOB, bank account, nominations etc.

To know about Client Master List “Click Here ( https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/share-market/guide-to-client-master-report )“

faqs.question: How can I get a copy of my Client Master List (CML)?
faqs.answer:
While we dont have reports yet.

We are working on it to make it avaible to you ASAP.

You can follow our product updated on our blog.

faqs.question: What is Client Master List?
faqs.answer:
Client Master List (CML) is a document with details of your DEMAT account providing your information such as name, address, DOB, bank account, nominations etc.

To know about Client Master List “Click Here ( https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/share-market/guide-to-client-master-report )“

faqs.question: How can I get a copy of my Client Master List (CML)?
faqs.answer:
While we dont have reports yet.

We are working on it to make it avaible to you ASAP.

You can follow our product updated on our blog.

faqs.question: What is a Contract Note?
faqs.answer:
A contract note is a confirmation of trades done on a particular day.

To know more “Click Here (https://www.angelbroking.com/knowledge-center/online-share-trading/what-is-a-contract-note-and-how-to-read-it )“

faqs.question: How can I download the Contract note?
faqs.answer:
You can download the day-wise contract note from our app. Follow the steps below.

• Go to the Account section on the App.

• Go to Statements

• Click on Trade executed

• You will find an option to download the contract note here.

We also send you the contract note to your registered email ID.

faqs.question: What is Holding statements?
faqs.answer: The holding statement provides all the details of your portfolio/holdings at any given time. You will find the stock names, average price, quantity, and other details in the holding statement.

faqs.question: How can I download Holding statements?
faqs.answer:
You can download your holding statements in an Excel sheet by following these steps.

• Login to your Angel One account.

• Go to the Portfolio section on the App.

• Choose Equity, Mutual Funds, SGB, etc.

• Click on the download button on the top right part of the screen.

faqs.question: When will my portfolio be updated with my latest investments?
faqs.answer: Your portfolio will be updated with your latest investments on an immediate basis

faqs.question: What is a Ledger Statement?
faqs.answer:
Ledger is a record of your account transactions, updated daily.

It contains details of fund pay-ins and fund withdrawals, payments made for purchases, payments received for sell transactions, and charges incurred.

It also gives a running balance of the cash limit in your account.
For details on how to read ledger “Click Here (https://www.angelone.in/knowledge-center/share-market/ledger-narration)“

faqs.question: How can I download Ledger statements?
faqs.answer:
You can download your ledger statement by following these steps.

• Login to your Angel One account.

• Go to the Account section in the application.

• You will find the Statements/Ledger section on this screen. Click on it.

• Select the time period.

• Click on the download button on the top right part of the screen.

faqs.question: When will my funds pay-in be reflected in my ledger?
faqs.answer:
Reflection of funds in your account varies with the payment partner / option selected by you –

Upto 5 minutes – UPI Payments / Google Pay

Upto 15-30 minutes – Net Banking

Upto 3 hours – NEFT / RTGS

faqs.question: When will my ledger be udpated with my trading transactions?
faqs.answer: Your Ledger will be updated with your trading transaction by the end of the trading day.

faqs.question: When will Funds reflect in my Demat account?
faqs.answer:
Reflection of funds in your account varies with the payment partner / option selected by you –

UPI Payments / Google Pay – Instantly

Net Banking – Instantly

NEFT / RTGS – 3-4 Hours

faqs.question: How can I download Profit & loss (P&L) statements?
faqs.answer:
You can download the P&L statements from the last two years by following these steps.

• Login to your Angel One account.

• Go to the Account section in the application.

• You will find the Profit and Loss section on this screen. Click on it.

• You can see Profit & loss for the selected date range.

• Click on the download button.

• Choose the Detailed Tax P&L statement if you are filing ITR.

• Select the date range and click on download.

Please note that you will also find short-term and long-term capital gains in tax P&L.

faqs.question: What is trade history summary report?
faqs.answer: Trade history report contains details about all your transactions and corresponding charges with other information such as date, type, and segment of order.

faqs.question: How can I download the trade history summary report?
faqs.answer:
You can download the trade summary report from our app. Follow the steps below.

• Go to the Account section on the App.

• Go to Trades and charges

• Click on Download trade history

faqs.question: What is family declaration?
faqs.answer: As per regulatory requirement, every KYC account should have a separate and unique mobile number and email address . In case if account holder wishes to use common email Id/ Mobile number for more than one account of family, it can be done after submitting a written declaration giving required details and duly signed by people involved.

faqs.question: What relationships are permitted as per SEBI to be considered as family for this purpose?
faqs.answer: Family for this purpose has been defined by SEBI as self, spouse, dependent parents and dependent children (in case of individual account holders)

faqs.question: What relationship can be given for clients having no- individual category of account such as company, trust, HUF, AOP etc.
faqs.answer: In case of non-individual category of account, if common email id/mobile number is used for more than one account then relationship can be defined as “Authorised Signatory” and the supporting needs to be submitted along with declaration such as Board resolution copy, trust/partnership deed or other such officially valid document approved giving detalils of authorized persons.

faqs.question: Are siblings or other relationships such as daughter-in-law, son-in-law allowed for considering family for this purpose?
faqs.answer: No. Only SEBI defined relationships of self, spouse, dependent parents and dependent children are allowed to be considered as family for this purpose. Anything else apart from this is not allowed.

faqs.question: What if the client is found to be using the common email id/mobile number without allowable relationship?
faqs.answer: Such account will be considered as invalid KYC accounts and will be suspended in both trading and demat account till the time unique valid KYC credentials are updated.

faqs.question: How can the client change their email ID and/or Mobile number to avoid non-compliance?
faqs.answer: Modification request can be submitted to change the mobile number/email ID by submitting request from the profile page of client’s account login.

faqs.question: Where can a client find the Family Declaration Form?
faqs.answer:
Client can download the Family Declaration Form from here (https://w3assets.angelone.in/wp-content/uploads/pdfs/Family-Declaration-Revised.pdf?_gl=1*1raos6f*_ga*MTY5Njg2MzUyNi4xNzAwMDI5Nzg5*_ga_CDX93S7LDP*MTcwMDAyOTc4OS4xLjEuMTcwMDAzMDI2Mi42MC4wLjA.). Send the duly signed scan copy on support@angelbroking.com (mailto:support@angelbroking.com).  Hard copy of declaration can be sent at below mentioned address.

Angel One Limited.

5th Floor Akruti Star Andheri (E)

Mumbai- 400 093

faqs.question: Who needs to sign the Family Declaration Form?
faqs.answer: The client who wants to use common email Id/ Mobile number, will mention the demat and trading account details and sign at the bottom of the page. If the demat account has more than one holder, all the holders will sign at respective place. The person who is Sellf (whose email id /mobile number is used will sign at the place “Signature of the related person”.

faqs.question: How can I close or delete my Angel One account?
faqs.answer:
We are sorry to hear that you want to close your account.

You can click here (https://angeloneapp.page.link/?link=https://www.angelone.in/emod2/accountClosure?=nonTradeToken%3D&apn=com.msf.angelmobile&isi=1060530981&ibi=com.angelbroking.angeleye) to submit an account closure request or please follow the below steps.

• Navigate to the Profile section on the Account screen of the app.

• Scroll to the bottom of the screen and click on “Close Demat and Trading Account”.

• Read the disclaimer and proceed.

• Your account closure request will be processed in 3 working days.

Please note that the account closure is permanent. Once it is closed, you can not open an account with Angel One within 90 days.

We look forward to serving you again in the future.

faqs.question: Can I close my Angel One account temporarily?
faqs.answer: No, you can not close your account temporarily. Account closure is permanent. However, you can freeze (https://angeloneapp.page.link/?link=https://www.angelone.in/emod2/accountFreeze?nonTradeToken%3D&apn=com.msf.angelmobile&isi=1060530981&ibi=com.angelbroking.angeleye) your account, if you detect any suspicious activities.

faqs.question: How can I freeze my Angel One account?
faqs.answer: You can freeze your account by visiting the Profile (https://angeloneapp.page.link/?link=https://www.angelone.in/emod2/accountFreeze?nonTradeToken%3D&apn=com.msf.angelmobile&isi=1060530981&ibi=com.angelbroking.angeleye) page on the app. Scroll down and click on Temporary Account Freeze. Read the disclaimer and proceed.

faqs.question: Why am I unable to submit an account closure request?
faqs.answer:
To close your account, please make sure the below conditions are satisfied.

• No holdings in your portfolio

• No open positions

• No open trade

• No active SIPs

• No MF Units

• No active IPO order

• No pledge holdings

• No debit/credit in your account balance

The above conditions should be satisfied for submitting an account closure request.

faqs.question: Can I close my Angel One account and reopen it later?
faqs.answer: Once you close your Angel One account, it is permanently closed. However, you can open a new demat account with Angel One after 90 days from the closure.

faqs.question: How much time does it take to close my Angel One account?
faqs.answer: It will take up to 3 working days to close your account.

faqs.question: How to close my Angel One account and transfer my holdings?
faqs.answer:
We are sorry to hear that you want to close your account.

You can click here (https://angeloneapp.page.link/?link=https://www.angelone.in/emod2/accountClosure?=nonTradeToken%3D&apn=com.msf.angelmobile&isi=1060530981&ibi=com.angelbroking.angeleye) to submit account closure request or please follow the below steps.

• Navigate to the Profile section on the Account screen of the app.

• Scroll to the bottom of the screen and click on “Close Demat and Trading Account”.

• Read the disclaimer and proceed.

• Your account closure request will be processed in 3 working days.

Please note that the account closure is permanent. Once it is closed, you can not open an account with Angel One within 90 days.

Note: If you want to close the account and transfer your holdings, please submit a request by uploading your CML copy of the DP where you want to transfer your holdings. The CML copy should be duly signed and stamped by the respective DP. 

We look forward to serving you again in the future.

faqs.question: How can I set price or volume alerts on the Angel One mobile app?
faqs.answer:
You can set a price or volume alert on the Angel One mobile app by following the below steps.

• Select the desired stock and click on Stock details.

• Click on the alarm icon in the top right corner.

• Set alerts based on either price or volume; Configure the parameters & conditions.

• Press Create Alert.

• To view or modify alerts, go to the home page, click the bell icon at the top, and visit the Alerts section.

faqs.question: How can I set price or volume alerts on the web?
faqs.answer:
• Hover over the desired stock in your watchlist.

• Go to the overflow menu (⋮).

• Click Add Alert.

• Choose between Price Action and Technical Indicators.

• Configure the parameters, conditions, and other details.

• Press Create Alert.

• To view or modify alerts, go to the Orders tab and visit the Alerts section.

faqs.question: How can I enable or disable notifications?
faqs.answer:
Notifications can be managed only on the mobile app. To change notification settings:

• Go to Account.

• Select Settings.

• Scroll to Manage Notification at the bottom of the screen.

faqs.question: Why did my account get deactivated?
faqs.answer:
Your account may become dormant/deactivated due to the following reasons: 

• You have not done any financial transaction (trading, pay-in, etc) with Angel One for more than a year.

• If any of the following 6 profile details are missing: name, PAN, address, income range, mobile number, email id 

• You have been debarred from trading by SEBI.

• There is an outstanding balance issue.

faqs.question: How can I reactivate my dormant account?
faqs.answer:
• To reactivate your account, login to the angel one app on your device or web using the link angelone.in/login (https://www.angelone.in/login)

• Verify the login using otp sent to your registered mobile number, email

• Post otp verification, you will be shown the dormant status of your account along with the reason

• Click on “Reactivate Account” button

• Confirm your personal details and click on “proceed”

• You will be required to do the 2 factor authentication using your pan number registered with Angel One account

• Post successful 2FA verification, your request will be submitted and your account will be activated within 1-2 working days

faqs.answer: As per regulatory requirement, every KYC account should have a separate and unique mobile number and email address . In case if account holder wishes to use common email Id/ Mobile number for more than one account of family, it can be done after submitting a written declaration giving required details and duly signed by people involved.

faqs.answer: No. Only SEBI defined relationships of self, spouse, dependent parents and dependent children are allowed to be considered as family for this purpose. Anything else apart from this is not allowed.

faqs.question: What if the client is found to be using the common email id/mobile number without allowable relationship?
faqs.answer: Such account will be considered as invalid KYC accounts and will be suspended in both trading and demat account till the time unique valid KYC credentials are updated.

faqs.question: How can the client change their email ID and/or Mobile number to avoid non-compliance?
faqs.answer: Modification request can be submitted to change the mobile number/email ID by submitting request from the profile page of client’s account login.

If the demat account has more than one holder, all the holders will sign at respective place.
